loans.name: Tete

texts.en:
Tete is 35 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is single and has four children between the ages of 5 and 23, and three of them attend school. Tete has been operating a table for the past five years selling soap, rice, and oil among others. She says sometimes she experience losses but not all of the time.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, soap, etc. for her business. Tete hopes to extend her business in others counties and send her children to college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old from Liberia, and she lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and her husband is a teacher. They have three children, between the ages of 8 and 18, who are presently in school and living at home. She completed her education up to the Grade 6 level.  

For the past five years she has been running a warehouse where she sells coal by the bag. She started this business by selling on a table in the market and learned the ways of selling from her uncle's wife. She is very happy with her business because she makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business.  Her plan is to educate her children. She appreciates BRAC Liberia and the lenders who are providing support.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en:
Jestina is 29 years old and lives in New Kru Town.  She is married and has two children aged 7 and 13. They attend school and live at home. 

She has operated a shop for the past 8 years to sell rice, oil, coconuts, and other items. She has little capital for operating expenses. She requests a loan to purchase more rice, oil, coconuts, etc. for her business.

Jestina  plans to build house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, coconuts, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a mother of a one-year-old boy.  She is a teacher by profession and lives together with her child and husband.  Gloria has all along been using charcoal for cooking, and this had changed her room due to the effects of the soot.  She says that sometimes she realizes while at school that soot had soiled her clothes.  

Gloria is now happy that she has attained cooking gas.  Prior to getting this package, Gloria had never imagined that one day she will cook on cooking gas just because of the initial costs involved in getting it.  This Kiva fund has solved Gloria’s problem of going to class with dirty clothes.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package in order to keep her house and clothes clean

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a 34 years old and she is a shop attendant by profession.  Since childhood, Hanifa says that she has been cooking on either charcoal or firewood.  While cooking Hanifa says that smoke makes her either sweat or cry tears, and this has been some of the reasons why she does not usually go to the village for Christmas.  
Hanifa is now happy that she will be traveling to the village with her cooking gas package and she won't again cry or sweat while cooking a Christmas meal for her family.  She appreciates that the KIVA loan has enabled her to access cooking gas, which in turn will help her realize her dream of traveling to the village for Christmas.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that she can cook cleanly.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Deborah is young and single; she is a hair salon manager.  In the salon they use both electricity and charcoal to prepare hot water, which is used for washing their customers' hair.  Deborah says that charcoal is used only when electricity is off, however she is aware about the cost of both sources of energy.  She had recommended all along to the owner of the salon to buy gas, but the cost had been a deterrent.  This Kiva loan has enabled them to access cooking gas, and they are sure the cost of boiling water will reduce tremendously.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package in order to save on the costs of running her salon

loans.name: Jamina

texts.en:
Jamina is a 45-year-old woman married to Nurul, 60 years old. They live in a small town, Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri district. She is blessed with four children. All of them are now totally involved in studies. Jamina and her husband are basically illiterate and only know how to sign their names. In spite of being illiterate, they have a keen interest to give education to their children. 

Jamina herself is busy in housekeeping, while her husband makes foundations for houses in their rural area. The profit that comes from this business is not sufficient for them to cover their family expenses along with their children’s education. 

Jamina now decided to give financial support to her husband by taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can help her husband to buy more raw materials or supplies like wood, bamboo, straw, ropes, etc. for making firm foundations for houses. She is very much confident that she can earn more profit by increasing the quantity as well as quality of those raw materials. 

In the future, she wants to extend her business to provide her family a better pakka (concrete) house for living comfortably and to give her best to establish her children. She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS, as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like wood, bamboo, straw and ropes for making foundations for houses.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is 31 years old, married and a mother of five children (four sons and one daughter). She lives with her husband and children. Both Namita and her husband, Subhas, aged 48 years, are uneducated, and can only sign their names. Three of their children are students; one is in primary level, and the other two are in secondary level. They live in the small village North Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Both the husband and wife are engaged in the business of supplying sand and stones to the building contractor. Sand and stones are required at the time of construction of a building. They set up this business with a lot of effort. Both of them strive to get along in life and live a decent life.

They need to expand their business so as to generate more income to maintain the expenses of their family, which are growing day by day.

Namita asked for a loan from BJS to purchase more sand and stones to expand their business. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will further improve in the business and achieve her goals of giving financial support to her family and educating her children properly in the future.

She gives her full thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sand and stone for expanding the business.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is married and a rural housewife.  She is from the small village of West Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Kallan, and together they are raising their only son. He is receiving education and is in grade 3. Both Pratima and her husband have primary education.

Pratima's husband is engaged in a business of selling wood. He is very hardworking and enterprising and wishes to get ahead in life. He works hard to collect wood from his village and from the neighboring villages. He sells the wood to the carpenters. In this way, he earns money for his family.  

Pratima also helps him in his work after managing her household work. But the earnings are not sufficient to give financial sustenance to the family. They want to expand their business, which they cannot do because of a lack of resources.

Pratima has taken a loan to help her husband to purchase wood for his business. Her dreams are to upgrade their poor financial condition, well-educate her son and enhance her business for a secured future.

She gives her thanks to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) to help her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase wood for expanding the existing business of supplying wood.

loans.name: Group 15 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Luom is 40 years old. Currently, Luom and her husband work in agricultural production with a total monthly income of approximately 1,400,000 VND. They have two children: one grown-up and one is attending secondary school. Luom and her husband are living in a house with the paternal parents who are old and often get sick. She has to support them financially. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1990. Like other members of her group, due to economic hardship, her family is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded. With a portion of this loan, Luom will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their health and living conditions, as well as afford safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms. In addition, the facilities will provide convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community. In the picture, Luom is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa lives in New Kru town. She is married and her husband is a contractor. They both have three children who live at home and one is attending school. 

Over the past ten years, Theresa has been operating a shop selling coconuts, dried meat, and sugar. She started this business by selling for her mother and learned this way of selling from her mother. 

Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase more coconuts, dried meat, and sugar for her business. She plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts, dried meat, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida se encuentra estudiando actualmente en campo alto auxiliar de enfermería, escogió esta carrera porque siempre le ha gustado la idea de ayudar a las personas en todo sentido.
Escogió estudiar en campo alto porque le brindo oportunidades y facilidades para comenzar con el sueño, en este momento quiere contar con kiva para poder continuar con la carrera, la verdad seria muy útil porque no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder continuar con esta maravillosa carrera, con el aprendizaje, no quiere dejar este sueño a la mitad del camino y con kiva puede seguir luchando por esta meta.
Tiene como propósito terminar esta fase para a si conseguir un buen empleo para poder continuar con la carrera profesional como enfermera y desde ese mismo modo realizar la especialización en dos áreas, las cuales son pediatría y ginecostetra, por ese mismo motivo la vida esta unida al cuidado y el bienestar de las personas que lo necesitan.
Pudiendo culminar esas fases de la vida sabe que puede colaborar y ayudar a la familia económicamente, en la salud y cuidado que le pueda brindar diariamente.
Esta carrera es una de las mas duras, pero como recompensa es una de las mas hermosas porque va a vivir y compartir historias el día a día incomparables e inolvidables.
Carrera como esta ninguna, y por eso esta luchando por seguir con la carrera.
texts.en: Adelaida is currently studying to be a nurse at Campo Alto. She chose this field because she has always liked the idea of helping people, and chose to study at Campo Alto because they gave her an opportunity and assistance to start down the path towards her dream. Right now she wants to count on Kiva so that she can continue her studies. It really would be very useful because she doesn't have the resources necessary to continue in this amazing field and doesn't want to abandon her dream at the half-way mark. Together with Kiva she can continue striving for this goal. Her objective is to complete this phase and obtain a good job so she can continue with the nursing profession and specialize in two areas, namely pediatrics and OB-GYN. That way her life would be linked with the care and wellness of people who need it. After finishing these stages she knows she will be able to help her family financially, and healthwise because of the daily care she could provide. This is one of the most difficult fields of study, but also one of the most rewarding because she would be a part of incomparable and unforgettable stories every day. There's no other field like this one, and that's why she's striving to stick with it.

loans.use: To pay tuition for the semester

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Alimaa, 53 years old, lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and grandson in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been renting out a restaurant for living, and almost two years ago she decided to run photography shop. Now her photography business is almost meeting its second year and she has amassed quite a lot of experience regarding this business. 

She is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to buy a printer, frames, and colored paper. As a result, she can continue to run her business without any inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy a printer, frames, and colored paper.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet is 58 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for more than ten years. She has an extensive experience and is successful in her business. Specifically, she grows rice. She makes an income of $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

To improve her family’s finances, Samet is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she wants to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Enkhmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhmaa, 47 years old, lives with her husband and children in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. The family resides in an old, wooden house on a plot of land. She and her husband raise livestock and sell diary products for a living. Her main job is to make diary products out of milk and, after that, her husband sells them at the market. Also, her husband renders taxi services for additional income. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So, Enkhmaa is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. 

Using those materials, she will repair and insulate her house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place for her family. Also, the renovated house will require less burning of coal for heating, which will have a positive impact on efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, vacas y venta de animales menores chivos y cerdos desde hace 5 años , por lo que es conocida en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el ganado vacuno y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de leche para ofrecer en el mercado de la zona, generando ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana is 41 years old and lives with her family in the Buenos Aires district, known for its carob trees.  It’s residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Piura, in the northern coast of Peru.

She raises cattle and sells small animals, goats, and pigs and has done so for five years, for which she is known in the area.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 New Soles to buy feed for her cattle so she can increase her milk production to sell in the local market, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 64 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes arroz, aceites, azúcar, harinas entre otros y así abastecer su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Emilia, age 64, lives with her husband in the Zaña district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

They have a small grocery store where they sell basic needs products.  Her business is located in the back part of her house.  

She has requested a loan for 2,500 soles to buy groceries like rice, cooking oil, sugar, and flour, among others.  This way she will stock her business with the purchase of more merchandise to offer her customers.  She will be generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a mini variety store and sells processed foods for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of giving her child a good education. She meets up with her fellowship members every week to share stories of their work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for load wallets and SIM cards for mobile phones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Veronica works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. 

Veronica is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Conchita works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Conchita is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables for her business to sell.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can buy house and lot.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jean works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and fruits. 

Jean is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jovita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling cashew nuts. 

Jovita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, milk, sweet potato, etc for her food vending business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, milk, sweet potato, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing maintenance business.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from a boarding house. Erma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks for her general store business, like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could have her own land.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 61 years old, widowed, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal. 

Lourdes is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Febronia is a married woman in her late 40s with two children.  Her son and daughter are in school. 

For the past eleven years, she has been involved with a retail shop business to sell items like dry food, cooking oil, sweets, kerosine,and soaps etc. 

Febronia works daily from 8:30am to 11:00pm and is able to earn a small monthly profit. 

This is her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to restock out-of-stock products to resell. Her business is not yet grown to the level that yields a satisfactory returns.  Febronia repaid her previous loans and used them to buy new and sold-out products in order to meet her daily customer demands.  She reinvested her profit to expand the business and pay school fees and home expenses.

She is a hard worker and is thankful for your support.  Febronia dreams of opening another shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "TUPENDANE" which has 2 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock out-of-stock products.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall home-business to sell food to her neighbors and community. She faces a major business challenge of price fluctuation and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

She will use the 20,000 KES to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en: Bidala appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her restaurant business and earn a higher income that she used for her personal expenditures. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of rice, wheat flour, charcoal, onions, tomatoes, tea leaves, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, wheat flour, charcoal, onions, tomatoes, tea leaves and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, candles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and other groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mercedes is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Mercedes has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Mercedes has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Dionisia requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Dionisia has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 52 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Erlinda has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: This is Binti. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy khangas for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. Beside the khanga selling business, Binti sells dumplings. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support. The profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. Binti looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar for her dumpling selling business.

loans.name: Mayamu

texts.en:
Mayamu is a 35-year-old business woman from Liberia who lives and works in Logan Town. She is married to a local businessman and they have four children between the ages of 10 months to 15 years old. Of her four children, only two attend school and they all live at home. 

Mayamu did not attend school but she is a skillful business woman. For the past 18 years, she has been frying and selling plantains, kaka (flour dough which is edible with pepper souses), eddoe, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, flour, eddoe, oil, etc. for her business. Mayamu hopes to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, flour, eddoe, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy lives in New Kru Town. She is 39 years old and married with two children ages 17 and 22. Her children are in school and live at home. For the past four years she has been operating a small shop where she sells rice and water by the sack. She says some times buying goes slow but most of the time she realizes some profit. Nancy says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the little goods she could afford and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag and water by the sack for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag and water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Shampa

texts.en: Shampa is a 26-year-old housewife who is married to Prasanta, 41 years old. Their only son is studying in class V (grade 5). She has completed class VIII standard (grade 8) but her husband is illiterate. Throughout the day, she manages all the household work and her husband keeps himself busy selling grocery items from his grocery shop. Shampa wishes to extend this business because their grocery shop is in great demand in her area. There is only one shop in the village of Baroghoria at Dhupguri where the villagers usually buy their daily grocery items. She wants to renovate their shop with more grocery items but they have no capital to meet the demands of the shop. She learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and requested a loan to buy more grocery items for their shop. In the future, she wants to become a good entrepreneur and improve her business gradually with the profit she can earn from the shop. She can make her concrete house more beautiful with the profit from the business. Shampa sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha lives and works in New Kru Town, one of the oldest markets in Liberia. It is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. She is 38 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 and 22. They are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been operating a local restaurant where she sells rice and soup. She says sometimes business is slow. She says she started this business with a little money she could afford from her susu (local daily saving) and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, oil pepper, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Edis Suyapa

texts.es: Edis, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica desde hace 2 años, en busca de obtener ingresos para su familia. Vende arroz, manteca, azúcar, verduras, refrescos, maíz, pan, condimentos, churros, sal etc.  Ha obtenido varios préstamos para invertir en su negocio. Actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir de productos básicos como granos básicos, carnes, verduras, refrescos, huevos, pan, manteca y otros, con el fin de aumentar las ventas en esta temporada de Diciembre. Tiene  como meta hacer su negocio más grande  y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edis is 41 years old. She lives in a common law relationship with her husband. They have three children and live in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. 

She has been engaged in selling staple food items for two years in order to earn income for her family. She sells rice, butter, sugar, vegetables, soft drinks, corn, bread, condiments, fried pastry sticks, salt, etc.

She has obtained several loans for investment in her business. Currently she is asking for another 15,000 lempiras to stock basic products such as basic grains, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, eggs, bread, butter, and more, in order to increase sales around the December season. 

Her goal is to have a larger business and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock food products such as basic grains, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, eggs, bread, butter and other items to sell

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
This is Lucila, 43, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Joseph and is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Lucila operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are chicken and pork. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business.

Lucila dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pork and chicken meat needed for her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a 28,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store and a loading station for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina dreams. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Juana Luisa

texts.es:
Juana de 43 años de edad, debido a la situación económica de su familia, solo logro cursar hasta un 7º grado, y empezó a trabajar con su madre en la crianza de ganado de granja, su esposo es profesor y trabaja en un cantón cercano de su casa, sus 3 hijos están estudiando un 6º y 7º grado y una esta cursando ultimo año en la universidad.

Juana, desde que estaba muy pequeña se a dedicado a la crianza de animales de granja, ya que su madre le enseño al cuido de ellos, todos los días tiene que cuidarlos, que siempre no les falte el alimento, los que le ayudan es su hija mayor cuando regresa de la universidad.


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para comprar pollos de engorde y en la compra de concentrados para la alimentación de los mismos.

Espera sacar adelante en los estudios a sus hijos menores, hasta la universidad donde a podido llegar su hija mayor, en la crianza de pollos espera para el próximo año que le ingresen mas pollos, para que tenga mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Due to her family's economic situation, Juana, 43 years old, was only able to study until the 7th grade. She then began working with her mother raising farm animals. Her husband is a teacher and works in a canton close to their house. Her 3 children are studying in the 6th and 7th grades, and one is in her final year in university.

Juana, since she was very young, has spent her time raising farm animals. Since her mother taught her how to care for them, she has had to care for them everyday, making sure they have enough food. Her oldest daughter helps her when she returns from university.

The funds from the loan will be used to buy chickens for fattening, and to purchase chicken feed for these chickens. She hopes to get her younger children to university, as far as her oldest daughter has studied.

In raising chickens, she will wait until next year to get more chickens, so that she can have better earnings for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten and chicken feed.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora de 50 años de edad, debido a la economía de su familia, solo pudo estudiar hasta un 6º  grado; ya que tenia que trabajar con su padre y su madre quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, sus hijos todos son mayores de edad  2 de ellos ya tienen su propia familia y dos de ellas están con ella. Su esposo, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado de repasto.

Ella  se a dedicado a trabajar toda su vida, cuando empezó con sus padres luego una amiga le manifestó la compra y venta de ropa y empezó con este negocio y ayudandole a su esposo en los gastos familiares. Con mucho esfuerzo en el tiempo logro conseguir un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal, empezó con poca venta ya que se le hacia difícil el mantenerla.

 Hoy en día trabaja todos los días, tiene que trasladarse desde su casa a su negocio son 7 kilómetros, dos en ocasiones tiene que caminar o pagar una mototaxi para que la lleve hacia la ciudad, donde aborda un autobús que la conduce al puesto de trabajo, esto lo hace a diario y tiene que madrugar para estar a tempranas horas abriendo el negocio y cierra a las 5 de la tarde, donde tiene que hacer el mismo recorrido hacia su casa.

Los fondos del crédito, serán utilizados para la compra de ropa y para fortalecer mas el negocio que tiene en el mercado municipal.

Los sueños que tiene a futuro, es poder lograr comprar otro local; ya que quiere que su hija quien le gusta este negocio lo pueda desempeñar, con las ganancias va aumentando la mercadería
texts.en:
Dinora, 50, was only able to finish sixth grade and had to begin farming and raising livestock with her father and mother because of the family's financial situation. Her children are now grown; two have families of their own and two live with her. Her husband farms and raises grazing animals. 

Dinora has worked all her life. She started working with her parents. Later a friend showed her how to sell clothing, and she started this business to help her husband with the household expenses. Over time and with hard work, she set up a stall in the city market. Sales were slow at first, and it was hard to keep the business going. Now she works every day and has to get to her business, which is seven kilometers from her house. Sometimes she walks, and other times she takes a taxi to the city, where she boards a bus to get to work. She has to get up at dawn each day to open the business early in the morning. She closes at 5:00 p.m. to return home.

She will use the loan to buy clothing to stock her business at the city market. She dreams of one day having another stall so that her daughter, who likes the business, could run it. She will use her profit to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business at the city market.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 64 years old and married with ten children. Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines and has been in this business for 9 years. She also earns an income from buying and selling young coconuts.

Melinda requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Melinda has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Elsa has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Elsa is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business. Nancy has been in this business for 10 years and she earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables. Elisa has been in this business for 20 years. Elisa earns more income from farming vegetables.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business buying and selling rice. Elvira has been in this business for 5 years, and she earns more income from farming rice.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 56 years old and married with ten children.

Melva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melva has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business selling charcoal for 5 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Melva aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Dorina is a married woman in her mid thirties with two school-aged boys.  She has run a beauty salon for six years and works from 8:00am to 11:00pm to make a small monthly profit.

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy cosmetics and hair products.  Dorina successfully repaid her previous loans and used them to restock her beauty salon.  Dorina used her business profit to pay school fees and cover home food expenses. She dreams of opening a retail shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "TUNAWEZA" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair products for her business.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Almas is in his early 40s and is married with one school-aged child.  He has been a food vendor for five years.  He works daily from 7:00am to 8.30pm and is able to make a  monthly profit.

This will be his 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start a charcoal selling business and continue his fruit and vegetable business.  He has successfully paid back his loans.  He used the profit to pay for school fees, cover household expenses and buy small items for his business.  He will use this loan to buy popular fruit and vegetables and sacks of charcoal to resell. 

He dreams of making his business international.

Almas will share this loan with his loan group "PARACHICHI" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy popular fruit and vegetables and sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is 49 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Ma. Christina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She has now requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Christina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Marina has been in this business for 15 years now.

Marina requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia works hard to support her family. Simplicia is married and has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines.

Simplicia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Simplicia has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Simplicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous loan. It improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KSHS 30,000 to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, salt, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, salt, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Evilla

texts.en:
Evilla works hard to support her family. Evilla is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Evilla requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Evilla has been in this business for five years now.

Evilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients for her business, like cooking oil, bananas, flour, and sugar.

Lydia has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business, like cooking oil, bananas, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribeth is 43 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Maribeth has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Menuri

texts.en:
Menuri appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Velmon

texts.en: Velmon is 40 years old and live in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia. She is married and has four children between 12 and 19 years old. They are presently in school and living at home. Velmon stopped her education in the 9th grade. For the past 18 years, she has been running a table where she sells plantain. She started this business by selling for her aunty and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes lot of profit and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more plantain to increase her business. Her plans are to build another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more plantain to sell

loans.name: Juah

texts.en: Juah is married and has five children between the ages of 7 and 16. She was able to complete 12th grade before starting her business. She is good at managing her business, which she has been doing for the last seven years. She sells red oil in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more red oil to increase her sales. She said that besides fewer goods on her table market, she has no other problems for now. She received a little money from her husband to establish this business and learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys the flow of customers and her plan is to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more red oil to sell

loans.name: Elizer

texts.en:
Elizer lives in New Kru Town. She is 47 years old and she is married, with four children between 7 and 30 years of age. Elizer stopped schooling in the eighth grade and she decided to do business in order to make some money, to maintain her home. 

She has been frying and selling doughnuts to improve their lives. She started this business ten years ago, with a little money from her mother. She likes her business because it is profitable and she learned this way of selling from her friends. 

Elizer is requesting a loan to buy more flour, sugar, etc. for her business. Her plan is to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace 4 años que se dedica a la venta de banano verde, repollo, papas, tomate, y otras verduras. Este negocio lo realiza en forma ambulante, movilizándose a varias comunidades en un vehículo.  Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo el cual es por 25,000 lempiras para comprar mas verduras como bananos, repollo, tomate, papas etc. para vender y poder mejorar las ventas e ingresos. Como su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Señor Marco is 48 years old and is married.  He has three children and lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  He has always worked in trade.  

For four years he has worked selling green bananas, cabbage, potatoes, tomatoes, and other produce.  He carries out his business as a mobile vendor, visiting various neighborhoods in a vehicle.  He has asked for a second loan of 25,000 lempiras to buy more produce such as bananas, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, etc., to sell.  

He wants to able to improve his sales and income, because his goal to get his children ahead and give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell such as bananas, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives with her husband and their four children in a house they built themselves.  Caroline has been cooking on firewood and occasionally on charcoal.  However she finds lighting up a charcoal stove or firewood something of the past and would like to have more modern tools. 

Although they have heard about liquid petroleum gas (LPG), they did not think that it was an energy for the poor because they have always heard LPG as being an energy for the rich.

Caroline says that firewood used to be more available in the past but it appears that supplies are diminishing.  “We even sometimes go hungry when it rains”, she told WANA Solutions staff.  LPG can be used in any weather, and a loan from Kiva will support Caroline in acquiring a readily available and affordable form of energy.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman is a teacher by profession, married with two children.  He lives together with his wife.  Their main source of energy for cooking is charcoal, which is a very inconvenient source of energy.

Aman says that he is not able to light a charcoal stove within a short period of time, which makes it difficult for him to come home and cook lunch for himself on the occasions that his wife is away.  Aman is only able to take a 30 minute lunch break from school, and when Aman's wife is not at home he does not have enough time to heat up the stove and cook a nutritious meal.

With gas, Aman says that he can prepare his lunch by himself within a period of thirty minutes.  This would also allow his wife more flexibility to leave the house and work during the day.

loans.use: To pay for the package of cooking gas

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns more income from pre-paid mobile loading.

Leny is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing maintenance business.

Leny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines. Venancia has been in this business for 5 years and earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing maintenance business.

Venancia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 57, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Leve and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household, while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Nenita maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands, like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. 

A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s costs are lower than those in the catalog and the difference represents the profit that dealers are counting on as their income. 

Nenita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Nenita is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business.

Nenita dreams to add another business and hopes to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Miladis Yamilet

texts.es:
Miladis de 34 años de edad, se a dedicado a trabajar en el comercio informal, desde muy pequeña en compañía de su madre; ya que se dedicaba a esta actividad, la que le ayuda en el negocio es su hija mayor y su esposo es policía.


Ella  desde muy joven se a dedicado a trabajar en el comercio, con su madre; quien se dedicaba al comercio informal, luego cuando se caso empezó a trabajar por su cuenta y empezó en la venta ambulante de ropa. Luego con el tiempo pudo establecer su propio local en la ciudad, pero no se quedo con ese poco ingreso, se dedico a la venta de tortillas todos los días  tiene que madrugar, ya que su casa esta a 3 kilómetros de donde tiene el negocio y el bus que ingresa a ese lugar solo hace un viaje por la mañana y las 7 de la mañana ingresa a la ciudad y el regreso es por la tarde.


Los fondos del crédito, serán utilizados para  remodelar la casa, comprar puertas de metal y arreglo de las paredes de la casa

Los sueños que tiene a futuro, es poder sacar adelante en los estudios de sus hijos y si fuese posible hasta la universidad, y ampliar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Miladis, 34, worked from an early age with her mother and older sister in informal commerce. Her husband is a police officer. She began working in business informally with her mother as a youngster. When she married, she started working on her own, selling clothing as a street vendor. Over time, she managed to open a stall in the local market, but she didn't earn much. She then sold tortillas every day. She has to get up very early because her business is now three kilometers from her house. The bus that takes her to work only makes one morning trip, at 7:00 a.m., to the city. She returns home in the afternoon. 

She will use the loan to remodel her house, buy metal doors, and repair the walls. She dreams of educating her children, hopefully through college, and growing her business.

loans.use: to remodel her house, buy metal doors, and repair the walls.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice for her business buying and selling rice. Edna has been in this business for 3 years, and she earns more income from farming rice.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Scola is in her early forties and is single with one child who is still in school. She has been running a grocery store for two years now. She works from 12 noon to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Scola's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy beer, soda, water, juice, and spirits for grocery stock. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to again buy beer, soda, water, juice, and spirits for the grocery stock. Scola dreams of opening another grocery store in a different place. She appreciates whomever has supported her group to make progress.

Scola will share this loan with her loan group Muheza with four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, water, juice, and spirits for grocery stock.

loans.name: Pwani Group

texts.en:
Kulwa, who is in her early forties, is married and has four children who are in school. For twelve years now, Kulwa has managed her family by having three small businesses: a retail shop, a charcoal selling business, and a firewood business. She starts her businesses from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm per working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Kulwa's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to restock her retail shop with new and sold-out products. She also bought more firewood and sacks of charcoal. She is really appreciative of Tujijenge's loan support which has helped her businesses to expand. Kulwa has managed to pay back all her previous loans successfully. She used her profit to cover school fees and household expenses. She also used part of her profit to proceed on building. Kulwa will use this loan to buy out-of-stock products for her retail shop and buy sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell. She dreams to finish building her house. 

Kulwa will share this loan with her loan group Pwani which totals seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy out-of-stock products for her retail shop and buy sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Navigator Group

texts.en:
Pili, a business woman who has been running a charcoal and tailoring business for five years, is in her mid-30s and has four children, all of whom are in school. Working from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, she has the capacity to make a good profit. 

This is Pili's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans, all fully repaid, to increase her stocks of charcoal; profits were applied to school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy business tailoring materials and sacks of charcoal to resell. Her dream is to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business. 

Pili will share this loan with her group, "Navigator," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business tailoring materials and sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 29 years old. She lives in Gaza with her husband and her four children. She has a shop where she rents dresses and operates a beauty salon. She opened her business more than eight years ago and it helped with the family income because her husband works as a taxi drive and earns only a small salary. They are a big family and need to take care of their kids.

Manal asked Ryada for this youth loan to build an attic to store the dresses and to redecorate her shop in order to increase her stock. She is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve her goals. Her dream is to be well known in the city so she tries to give the best service to her clients 
. 
Manal is very grateful to everyone who helps her. Her husband appears in the photo. For cultural reasons, she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologies.

loans.use: to build a storage area and redecorate her store

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
This is Habiba. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more items for her beauty salon. She has been in this business for over three years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KSHS to buy more stock of shampoo, hair oil, hair conditioners, and braids for her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. 

Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the family's expenses.. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more beauty supplies for her salon

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennifer is 29 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jennifer has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like slippers, knives, blouses, etc. to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marina has a cocoa vending business in the Philippines. Marina requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 8 years. Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Yolanda requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 44 year old woman married with four children.  They all live in a studio flat where children share an area which doubles as a provisions store.  The store is dusty due to the charcoal which they normally use for their cooking needs.

Hamza believes that the dust from charcoal might be the cause of unending flu and illness in her house.  She would like to purchase a gas stove package, which includes gas, a gas cylinder, a stove, and a regulator.  The gas will  allow her to have enough space for her children to play, and will mean an end to harmful dust in the places where her children sleep.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package

loans.name: Jacent

texts.en:
Jacent is a 32 year old woman who lives with her husband and her child.  She has been using charcoal and firewood together for cooking.  She spends most of her time at home cooking for the children while her husband goes out to work. 

They buy charcoal on daily basis, meaning that sometimes it is not possible to buy the charcoal and return home in time to complete the cooking.  Jacent's husband is the only breadwinner in the house, and although Jacent also wishes to earn money, her cooking and childcare responsibilities leave her with little time for paid work.

Gas stoves heat quickly and do not require someone to be available all the time to prevent energy wastage as with charcoal and firewood.  With support from a Kiva loan Jacent will cook with gas, and she feels it is high time she also looks for employment.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package that will allow her to cook meals quickly

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, filthy conditions, and over population. Good aspects include that rooms are a bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, it contain one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and food is cheaper. Norah is 45 years old, married with 9 children with ages between 13 and 30 years old; only five are in school and live at home. For the past 3 years she has been operating a table market in the local market selling used clothes. She started this business with money from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her aunt. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to expand her business and help her children with money.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita tiene 33años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el Caserío de Culpon una zona rural de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de combustible gasolina y gas, abasteciendo en su gran mayoría a los pobladores de su caserío, tiene un buen posicionamiento en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para incrementar su negocio con la compra de balones de gas y de esta manera atender a la demanda en la zona, generando, mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Saritais 33 years old and lives with her son in the Culpon settlement, located in the rural Nueva Arica zone, where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. 

She sells fuel; gasoline and gas and supplies most of the local population.  She is well positioned in her area and is asking for a loan of 1,500 New Soles so she can expand her business by buying gas cylinders so she can meet the local demand and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, es una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su esposo Aydee se dedica al a venta de cerveza en su domicilio, desde hace tres años tienen una clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de gaseosas, vinos, y champagne para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aydee is 52 years old and lives with her husband and children in the La Matanza district.  This is a tranquil community and its population are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

She and her husband sell beers from her home.  She’s been doing this for three years and has a considerable number of customers.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 New Soles to buy soft drinks, wines, and champagne to offer her customers and be able to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Khulan

texts.en:
Mrs. Khulan, who is 23 years old, lives with her husband in a house on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an environmentalist at a mining company for eleven months. 

Her husband recently filled out job application for a pizza delivery company, and the company requested him to own an automobile for delivery. So she is requesting a loan of MNT 8,000,000 to buy an electric car for her husband. 

The advantage of electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. 

Her husband has no particular profession.  The pizza delivery job is ideal for him as Mongolian economy today faces difficulties, and unemployment is high. If she and her husband both work, it is easier to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an electric car so her husband can get a delivery job.

loans.name: Socrates

texts.en:
Mr. Socrates is an entrepreneur that lives on the remote island of Papua, Indonesia.  He tells why he needs this KIVA loan in its own words: 

"[My] business started as one kiosk in the city of Manokwari and one kiosk in a nearby village.  I am now in the beginning stages of opening two more kiosks in two other villages in the next several months, so that those villages can also have access to clean and affordable drinking water.

In the province of West Papua, Indonesia, very few people have access to drinking water that is both safe AND affordable.  Many people are forced either to purchase bottled water that is very expensive or boil their own water which also is expensive, labor-intensive, and pollutes the environment.  In the areas far from the city, because boiling water requires so much work, many people risk drinking untreated water and, as a result, continually suffer from water-borne illnesses. Nazava’s water filtration technology provides a superior alternative in its simple design, affordability, and ability to produce safe drinking water. My business’s primary goal is to actively portray Jesus Christ’s love for all people by caring for the physical needs of the people of West Papua via:

1.	Providing a safe, affordable, and practical clean drinking water solution to the communities throughout Papua Barat.
2.	Teaching and equipping other aspiring Papuan entrepreneurs how to open their own kiosks in their villages and how to run a successful kiosk business selling the Nazava filters.

Because the demand for the Nazava filters is so high, I have trouble keeping sufficient stock to meet the demand.  I do not charge a high profit margin, which makes it difficult to increase my business’ inventory.  This loan will allow me to increase my inventory and minimize the time I am out of stock and cannot serve the local community."

loans.use: to provide a safe, affordable, and practical clean drinking water solution to the communities throughout Papua Barat

loans.name: Kanysh

texts.ru: Каныш 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Каныш - средне-специальное образование, основной деятельностью семьи Каныш является сельское хозяйство, а именно: животноводство и полеводство, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Каныш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, а также Каныш параллельно занимается полеводством, имеет 2,70 ГА поливной земли. На указанных землях семья Каныш выращивает фасоль, кукурузу и клевер. Во избежание падежа скота Каныш два раз в год проводит ветеринарные мероприятия. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныш обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Каныш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Kanysh is 30 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising two children. Kanysh has a specialized high school education. Agriculture is the main activity of Kanysh's family, specifically raising livestock and crops, having started 10 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Kanysh today has on her homestead: one dairy cow, one horse, and one steer. Kanysh is also engaged in parallel in agriculture and has 2.70 hectares of arable land. On these lands, Kanysh's family grows beans, corn and clover. To avoid loss of cattle, Kanysh twice a year conducts veterinary activities. Monthly income consists of 13,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kanysh turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for expanding the headcount of livestock.

Kanysh plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As the married parent of six children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from manicure/pedicure.  

Jovita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, spices, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc., for her general store business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, spices, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending.  

Gloria is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to process to dried fish for her fish business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to process to dried fish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 43 years old and married, with two children, who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.
