loans.name: María Edelia

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su s 3 hijas, quienes tienen las edades entre 17, 14 y 13 años. Las niñas se encuentran estudiando aun. y María tiene un nivel académico de 9º grado.


Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, como propietaria y esto lo aprendió tomando en cuenta las necesidades que tenía para su  familia, así fue como tomo la decisión con su esposo de poner ese negocio.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para mejorar la vivienda y para la compra de más maíz para continuar, con su negocio de tortillas y satisfacer las necesidades que a diario se le presentan.

Ella pretende tener una vivienda que reúna,  las condiciones para su familia, como también un negocio que le permita obtener sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and lives with her 3 children aged 13, 14 and 17 years old. They are all studying. María studied up to Grade 9. For the past ten years she has been selling tortillas as a business. She learned this activity considering the needs of her family and made the decision with her husband to open this business.

The loan that María is requesting is to improve her home and to buy more corn to continue with her tortilla business and to provide for the daily necessities that occur. She wants to have a house that unites the needs of her family and that of her business which allows her to generate the income that sustains her family.

loans.use: to improve her house and to buy corn to continue her tortilla business.

loans.name: Dora Emilse

texts.es:
Dora, a sus 29 años de edad, con la idea de salir adelante, abrió un local desde el cual comercializa telas e hilos, y ofrece servicio de confección. Es muy reconocida en el medio por su perseverancia y empuje, siempre con una sonrisa capaz de contagiar a todos sus clientes.

Con el crédito espera poder comprar surtido al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros) y, ofrecer en la temporada de fin de año mayor variedad a todos sus clientes, y poco a poco generar los recursos que tanto necesita para poder lograr su sueño anhelado, que es comprar su propio local.
texts.en:
Dora, at the age of 29, with the idea of getting ahead, opened a shop where she sells cloth and thread and offers sewing services. She is well-known in the area for her perseverance and drive, always ready with a smile to share with her customers.

Dora would like to buy stock wholesale (cloth, thread, buttons, etc.) with this loan. She will be able to offer her clients a greater variety of good at this holiday season and little by little generate the revenues she needs to fulfill her great dream, to own her own store.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (cloth, buttons, thread, etc.).

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 43 years old and married. She has four children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and she earns additional income from food vending and from selling vegetables.

Catalina has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell in her general store. Catalina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Catalina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 56 years old and married; she has eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Violeta requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Violeta would like to save money for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years selling household consumables such as wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES loan, Ngome wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to sell at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Cherie May

texts.en:
Cherie May works hard to support her family. Cherie May is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cherie May requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business such as pork, chicken, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc.

Cherie May has been in this business for seven years now.

Cherie May would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business such as pork, chicken, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Anibal

texts.es:
Carlos ha sido caficultor desde hace 35 años, el esta casado y tiene tres hijos.
Carlos esta en medio del proceso de conversión de café convencional a café orgánico. El quiere construir un establo y comprar 3 vacas para utilizar el estiércol como materia prima para hacer abonos orgánicos, esta inversión le costara 3.000.000 millones de pesos con esto el podrá iniciar su proceso de conversion a organico, mejorar la calidad y aumentar la producción del café para obtener mas recursos económicos y poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad y tener una vivienda digna.

El proceso de conversion a cafe organico es un riesgo para los campesinos de Colombia.  En dejar la seguridad y facilidad de usar quimicos, Carlos y FCC estan convencidos que vale la pena. Con este prestamo, Carlos puede invertir en un proceso integral al largo plazo que sea independiente, saludable, y balanceado. Un prestamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su venta, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos has been a coffee producer for 35 years. He is married and has three children.

Carlos is in the middle of a process of converting from conventional coffee to organic coffee. He wants to build a stable and buy three cows to use the manure as a raw material in making organic fertilizers. This investment will cost him 3,000,000 pesos. With it he will be able to start the process of converting to organic, better quality, and increased coffee production so that he can make more income and be able to send his children to university and have a respectable home.

The process of converting to organic coffee is risky for Colombian farmers. Carlos and FCC are convinced that leaving behind the security and ease of using chemicals is worth that risk. With this loan, Carlos can invest in an integral, long term process that will be independent, healthy, and balanced. A loan with Kiva represents a sustainable future for his sales, his land, and his family.

loans.use: to convert to organic coffee.

loans.name: Muriba 1 Group

texts.en:
Muriba 1 is a group of six farmers in Kuria West district in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru International to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Muriba 1 collectively guarantee the loan.

Richard, who is raising his hand, is a first time member of the group. He is optimistic that his life as a farmer has taken a new turn and that he will be successful. He is 55 years old and is married with four children who are all now adults.
 
The loan from Kiva will help him to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will enable him to obtain higher yields. Richard, just like other members of his group, will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre, and sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. He plans to sell the surplus and invest the money in two local cattle which he will later sell.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en:
Fialelei is a 65-year-old, married woman, with children. She has a small plantation. She grows vegetables, which she sells at her market, to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Fialelei has requested a loan, with which she plans to buy fertilizer, wheel barrow, mist blower, spade, gloves, bush knives, and a rake. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Fialelei hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, wheel barrow, mist blower, spade, gloves, bush knives, and a rake

loans.name: Porita

texts.en:
Porita is married with five children and manages her retail store, specializing in selling spices and assorted grocery goods in the market. She has been in her business for five years, and it helped to aid her husband's income for the family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to resell. She wants to improve her business, and she's hopeful to gain more profit for a better living of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en: Foisaga is 43 years old and living with her partner for 22 years now and five children. She makes and sells design fabrics to earn a living, and has been doing this for one year. Foisaga has requested a loan to buy paints, paint brush, design board, fabric materials, and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, paint brush, design board, fabric materials, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Baby Liza

texts.en:
Baby Liza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Baby Liza requested a 13000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional seeds for her farm.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Baby Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds for her farm

loans.name: Kerana

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Kerana works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried coconut meat. Kerana is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her buy-and-sell banana business.

Kerana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Cherriel

texts.en:
Cherriel is 30 years old and married. Cherriel has four children and three are still in school.

Cherriel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherriel requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherriel has been in this business for 5 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cherriel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu, because she has gone far with her business with support from the loans.

Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She plans to use it to buy five litres of shampoo, conditioner, hair braids, and gel. She thanks Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy five litres of shampoo, conditioner, hair braids, and gel

loans.name: Lenelyn

texts.en:
Lenelyn works hard to support her family. Lenelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lenelyn requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat, such as paint, wood, etc.

Lenelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Lenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat, such as paint, wood, etc.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over thirteen years, he has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. He cites seasonality as his major business challenge. Mangale dreams of establishing a boutique, in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business. He decided to join Yehu, in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business.

loans.name: Ever Ulises

texts.es:
EVER DE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA OCTAVO GRADO, PUES LOS ESCASOS RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO LE PERMITIERON SEGUIR ESTUDIANDO Y TUVO QUE DEDICARSE DE LLENO A TRABAJAR, SU PAREJA ES AMA DE CASA, HAN PROCREADO DOS HIJOS DE 4 Y DOS MESES DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMNETE, UNO DE HIJOS VA A EMPEZAR A IR AL KINDER.

 EVER ES AGRICULTOR EN PEQUEÑO, TRABAJA 7,000 METROS CUADRADOS DE MAIZ, LO APRENDIO DESDE NIÑO YA QUE SU PADRE ERA AGRICULTOR Y LE ENSEÑO ESTE TRABAJO, ADEMAS TRAJABA EN UN TALLER DE CARPINTERIA, DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS YA QUE HAY MOMENTOS EN LOS CUALES LA COSECHA NO DA MAS QUE PARA EL CONSUMO, PAGAR ALGUNAS DEUDAS, ÉL NO TIENE HORARIO DE TRABAJO PUES CUANDO ESTA EN EL TALLER ENTRA A LAS 7AM Y COMO GANA POR OBRA NO TIENE HORA DE SALIDA.

CON EL PRESTAMO VA A TRABAJAR 7,000 METROS CUADRADOS DE MAIZ DE RIEGO, QUE SI DIOS LO PERMITE EN ABRIL ESTARA SACANDO LA COSECHA. CON EL PRESTAMO TIENE MAYOR OPORTUNIDAD DE SALIR ADELANTE, PUES EL DINERO QUE GANA EN EL TALLER DE CARPINTERIA LO UTILIZARA PARA EL ESTUDIO  DE SU HIJO Y PARA LA ALIMENTACION DE SU FAMILIA.


  SUS SUEÑOS SON TENER UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA Y ASI PODER AYUDAR A SUS HIJOS, A QUE PUEDAN TENER EL ESTUDIO QUE EL NO TUVO. EL PRESTAMO LE AYUDARA DE IMPULSO PARA TRABAJAR, SERA MAS SACRIFICADO PERO ESTA SEGURO QUE SOLO ASI PODRA CUMPLIR CON SUS SUEÑOS Y LOS DE SU FAMILIA. TAMBIEN PIENSA YA NO SER EMPLEADO DEL TALLER, SINO TENER SU PROPIO TALLER DE CARPINTERIA.
texts.en:
Ever is 24 years old. He only studied until the 8th grade because financial resources were scarce and he could not continue his school work and so he dedicated himself full time to working. His partner is a housewife and they have 2 children. One is 4 and about to begin kindergarten and one is 2 months old.

Ever is a small farmer. He works 7,000 square meters of corn. He learned as a youth since his father was a farmer and taught him this work. He has also been working for 15 years in a carpentry workshop as there are times when the harvest only provides enough for consumption and he needs to pay some expenses. He does not have a work schedule but when he is in the workshop he gets there at 7:00AM and as he is paid by piece work he does not have a set departure time. 

He plans to use the loan to work 7,000 square meters of irrigated corn, God willing, to harvest in April. The loan gives him an opportunity to get ahead as the money that he earns in the carpentry workshop will be used to pay for school fees for his son and for feeding the family.

His dreams are to have a better quality of life and to be able to support his children so they can have the education he was not able to have. The loan will provide a motivation to work and make more sacrifices in order to be certain not only that he can meet his dreams and those of his family but also he is thinking of not being an employee of a workshop but to have his own carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to work 7,000 square meters of irrigated corn.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
After losing her husband to the violence of South Sudan, Joyce fled the country with her children in search of a new life. When she arrived in Kenya, she made contact with a British organization that assists refugees in Nairobi, and after a few months of waiting, Joyce and her family were permitted to immigrate to the United States as refugees.

Despite experiencing the tremendous culture shock of moving to a new country, Joyce made the best of her situation. She found a job at a San Diego health center and worked there until she was recently laid off.  She began looking for employment through a temporary employment agency, but had difficulty finding a job in the crowded job market. Instead of letting her circumstances hold her back, she instead saw it as an opportunity to take her employment into her own hands. 

She began selling a variety of cultural goods, such as traditional Sudanese clothing and art pieces, taking out her first microloan to fund her venture.  She eventually moved into selling lotions, perfumes and crèmes at local swap meets, focusing on selling consumer goods that would appeal to the local African immigrant community.  

Now on her eighth microloan, Joyce has demonstrated tremendous character through the years with regular, on-time repayments and a commitment to growing her business. She plans to use her $4,000 Kiva loan to increase her inventory, enabling her to sell at additional outdoor markets and ultimately grow her income.

When asked what her business dream would be, she shared, “I want to become financially independent and perhaps start my own import and export business one day.”

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Sreyheang

texts.en:
Sreyheang (pictured here), age 23, is single. She lives with her parents in a village in Phnom Penh suburb. 
Sreyheang had finished her baccalaureate and wants to continue her bachelor's degree at the university where she is majoring. Hence, she has decided to apply for a loan to pay her school fees.

Credit to study a bachelor's degree in Cambodia: There are four years, divided into two semesters each year; first and second semester. Students can prefer to pay school fees by a year or by a semester, depending on the school or university's privacy policy.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia works hard to support her family. Crescencia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Crescencia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Crescencia has been in this business for 25 years.

Crescencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lolita has been in this business for 4 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Crystal Mae

texts.en:
Crystal Mae is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Crystal Mae is 25 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Crystal Mae has a soft drink and ice vending business in the Philippines. Crystal Mae requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell.

Crystal Mae has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Crystal Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for 10 years, and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresa Aracely

texts.es:
Teresa es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, ella es casada su esposo se dedica los trabajos de estructuras metálicas, ellos tienen 2 hijos; una niña de 5 años y un niño de 2 años de edad y que actualmente la pequeña se encuentra estudiando la preparatorio, en su vivienda solo viven y dependen de  ella su esposo y su dos hijos. 

Teresa, se dedica a los trabajos de oficios domésticos en su hogar y cuidar a sus hijos; mientras su esposo sale al trabajo, comenta que desde que ella estaba pequeña se dedica a esta actividad, pues es un trabajo hereditario por parte de su mamá, que desde que estaba pequeña su madre le enseño a aprender este oficio, ella dice que es una actividad muy importante y que se siente orgullosa de desempeñarla en su familia y también ella siempre recibe el apoyo de su esposo en los trabajos que desarrolla. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su hogar; pues hasta el momento no cuentan con ese beneficio que es tan indispensables para ellos y que desde hace ya varios años tenían el deseo de poner la energía eléctrica en su hogar, este beneficio les permitirá a  su familia vivir más cómodamente en su hogar y no estar en el oscuro por las noches, esto les generara inseguridad en su hogar pues no se contaba con la iluminación adecuada.  

Teresa siempre ha querido seguir estudiando y trabajar a la vez, terminar una carrera universitaria. Vivir en un casa digna  para su familia y para su niño desea que sea una persona de bien que estudie mucho. El otorgamiento del crédito siente una gran oportunidad para ella y su familia, de seguir superándose día a día   y con el otorgamiento de futuros créditos que sacara para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is a young woman of 25 years who studied until ninth grade. She is married and her husband earns his living working working with metal structures. They have two children, a five-year-old girl and a two-year-old boy. The little girl is currently studying in pre-school. They live in their home and Teresa and her two children are supported by her husband.

Teresa dedicates herself to the work of the household chores in her home and the care of her children while her husband goes to work. She says that since she was small she has been engaged in this activity that was taught to her by her own mother. Since she was little her mother helped her learn this activity and Teresa says it is a very important activity and that she is proud to preform it for her family and that she is always supported by her husband in the work they do.

The loan she is requesting is for the installation of electricity in their home because, up to now, they do not have this service that is so necessary for them. For several years they have had the desire to put electricity in their home and not be in the dark at night, a condition which generated insecurity at home because there was no proper lighting.

Teresa has always wanted to continue studying and working and finish a college career. She wants to live in a house that is dignified and for her child to be a good person and study a lot. The granting of this loan feels like a great opportunity for her and her family to continue growing day by day and by giving the chance to take out future loans to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Marío Rodolfo

texts.es:
El joven Mario de 21 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora con un grado de estudio de bachiller general, que fue lo que pudieron darles sus padres, con mucho esfuerzo salió adelante. Vive solo con su madre, quien fue la que le ha ayudado en mucho; ya que perdió a su padre desde muy pequeño, hoy vive solo con su madre que ha significado mucho en la vida junto a crecido su hermano, quien le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas, y es así como trabajan juntos y salen adelante con los trabajos que realizan y de ellos solo su madre depende.

Mario se dedica a trabajos agrícolas desde que tenía 16 años de edad, su padre le fue enseñando, a como trabajar en el campo y es gracias a su padre que hoy conoce de mucho, sobre las diferentes actividades que requiere un cultivo, en esta actividades se involucra el hermano quien junto con el cultivan 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol. Para llegar a la zona de trabajo debe caminar 45 min, para realizar sus trabajos cuando también al momento de sacar su cosecha le toca que sacarlos cargándolos, en su espalda o en bestias y sus horas de trabajo no tiene si no que lo hace hasta que termine su trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pago de mano de obra, para sacar su cosecha ya que se le hace difícil a él solo y su hermano; porque es bastante los trabajos que tienen y con esto se estará ayudando al cliente que se le puedan facilitar el traslado de su cosecha a su casa y así poder sacar su cosecha para venderla y tener ingresos para salir con el crédito y ayudar a su madre en los gastos de su casa.

Piensa continuar trabajando, en la agricultura y poder cosechar más en el próximo año y para eso espera que su hermano siempre le ayude y también tenga el apoyo de su madre, para salir adelante y también piensa en poder comprar un terreno, para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mario is a hard-working young man of 21 years of age. He finished his High School which his parents struggled to provide him with in order to get ahead. He lives with his mother, who is the person who helped him in so much, growing up together with his brother. The brothers work together in agriculture and their mother is dependent on them.

Mario has worked in agriculture since he was 16. His father taught him to work the fields and thanks to this he has a lot of knowledge today about the different activities required to produce a harvest. He and his brother work together growing 10,500 square meters of corn and beans. They have to walk 45 minutes to get to their fields. And to work and to sell their harvest they have to carry the product on their backs or by animal. They don't have normal work hours, they work until the job is done.

The loan that Marío is requesting is to pay for labor to harvest their crops as it is too difficult for just him and his brother. They have a lot of work to do and this helps their client as the crops have to be transported to his house. From there the harvest can be sold and they will have income to pay the loan and help their mother with the household expenses.

Marío wants to continue working in agriculture and wants to harvest more in the coming season. So he hopes his brother will continue to help him. He also has the support of his mother to help him along. He is thinking of buying a plot of land to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest their crops.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married mother and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She is operating an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat, and the rest she will use to construct a stall for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat, and construct a stall for the business.

loans.name: Dallas

texts.en: Dallas is 25 years old, single with no children. She has a small bingo business, which she has been running for one year. Dallas needs a loan to buy a new bingo machine, bingo paper, a desk, and a chair. She will use her profits to improve her business. Dallas joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine, bingo paper, a desk, and a chair.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida (pictured here), age 23, is single. She lives with her parents, in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lida is now in the first year and first semester of her university program, where she is majoring in Accounting. She is applying for a loan to pay for her school fees. In the future, she hopes to become a staff member for a bank.

Credit to study for a bachelor degree in Cambodia: There are four years, divided into two semesters each year, first and second semester. And students can pay school fees for a year, or by the semester, depending on school or university policy.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Sam Ath (in the photo), age 25, is single. He lives with his parents on the Island of Mekong River. His father is a construction worker and mother is a weaver.

Sam Ath is now a third year student, majoring in Architecture. In addition, he works as an assistant for a company in Phom Penh. 
Sam Ath will graduate in 2016. In the future, he hopes to have a good job and get a salary of about $500 a month.

He has decided to apply for a loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 62 years old, a widow and has 3 adult children. She lives in Sepac Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. Celerina  has engaged in  the cocoa farming business since the moment she got married. This is the one source of her income. She earns a bimonthly income of 9000 PHP.

Celerina requested a new loan to buy materials such as lumber and to pay for labor for house renovations. She has been a CUMi member of Paglaum MPC since 2005.

loans.use: to  purchase  materials for house renovations.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is married with two children. She runs a general store in their village to supplement her husband's income from farming. With three years in the business, Miraflor is doing well. She is requesting a loan through GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She hopes to gain more profit to use for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Kadhe

texts.en: Kadhe appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Duván Alfonso

texts.es:
Duván, a sus 29 años de edad, en búsqueda de lograr sus sueños, y poder generar un ingreso estable, luego de haber sido empleado de una cadena de restaurantes muy reconocida a nivel mundial durante 2 años toma la decisión de abrir su propio negocio, una venta de helados, ensaladas de frutas, té helado, malteadas, y productos relacionados.

Con el crédito solicitado busca sacar adelante su negocio, y comprar un televisor para una mejor adecuación del local, y una granizadora, ya que sus clientes le han comenzado a solicitar productos granizados.

El espera en un futuro poder generar empleo y ayudar a otras personas que como el luchan por salir delante de una manera honesta y responsable. También desea en un futuro, cuando sus posibilidades económicas mejoren, crear una empresa de publicidad, ya que se ha capacitado en el tema, y ve que con ello podría aportar a su mismo negocio, y a otras microempresas que buscan ser conocidas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Duván, 29, is seeking to achieve his dreams to generate a steady income. After being employed by a recognized worldwide restaurant chain for 2 years, he made a decision to open his own business to sell ice cream, fruit salads, iced tea, milkshakes, and other related products.

With the loan he has requested, he will search for ways to bring his business forward and purchase a television to modify his establishment. He will also purchase a slush machine because his clients have been asking for slush beverages. 

He hopes in the future that he can create jobs and help other people in their struggle to get ahead in an honest and responsible manner. Also, in the future, when his budget improves, he'd like to create an advertising company as he has been trained in marketing and wants to see what this could contribute to his business and other microenterprises who seek to be known in the market.

loans.use: to purchase a TV and slush beverage machine for his restaurant.

loans.name: Maryory Alexandra

texts.es:
Maryory, a sus 27 años de edad, desea sacar adelante su proyecto de compra de mercancía como ropa, perfumes, entre otros, para realizar ventas al mostrador.

Ella busca generar ingresos para su sostenimiento y ayudar a su familia. Su objetivo con el crédito es poder hacer su primer inventario y comenzar a ofrecer sus productos a sus amigos, los cuales están dispuestos a ayudarle.

Su gran sueño es poder montar un almacén fuera de su casa, con una excelente vitrina, y ayudando a la sociedad generando posibilidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Maryory, 27, wants to move forward with her project of purchasing merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, and others, for her sales counter. She seeks to generate income to support and help her family. 

Her goal is to be able to purchase her first inventory and start selling her products to her friends who are willing to buy from her.  

Her dream is to build a store out of her house with an excellent showcase and help her community by generating employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están acompañadas y la última que está estudiando 1er  grado, una de las hijas que está acompañada vive aún en su casa al igual que la última. Con ella solo vive una hermana y dos sobrinas.


La señora tiene un negocio de elaboración, comercialización de matates ( Harcia ) ella lleva ya 3 años de dedicarse esta actividad, aprendió el oficio, porque una prima le enseño, vio que era una actividad que le podía generar ingresos para los gastos familiares; fue así como decidió dedicarse a ello. Antes de ser artesana trabajaba en un comedor de cocinera en la capital del país. El trabajo lo realiza en su casa, solo tiene que viajar cuando entrega el producto. A ella le ayuda su pequeña hija a realizar el trabajo. Para trabajar no tiene un horario establecido, si no que a cualquier hora cuando ha terminado los oficios domésticos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  30 conos de pita, el torno porque el que tiene es alquilado, comprara la carreta que es para hilar la pita. Mejorará sus ingresos, ya que tendrá su propio equipo de trabajo

Ella pretende ampliar su negocio y lo hará comprando más materia prima, para dar trabajo a una prima para aumentar así sus ingresos, con las ganancias piensa ayudar a su hija, para que estudie  y no se quede a mitad del camino y que pueda un día ser profesional .
texts.en:
Reina is 33 years old. She finish Grade 1. She has 3 children. Two are in common-law relationships and the other is in Grade one. One of the married daughters and the youngest daughter live with her. A sister and two nieces also live with her.

Reina has a business making and selling bags. She has been doing this for three years. She was taught this by a cousin and realized that it was an activity that could generate revenues to pay the household expenses so she decided to do it. Before she became an artisan she worked in a restaurant in the capital.

She works in her house and only has to go out to sell the product. Her young daughter helps her with the work. She has no fixed hours, she does it whenever she has completed the household chores.

The loan the Reina is requesting is to buy 30 cones of algave thread, a spinning wheel because the one she has is rented and spools to put the thread on. She will increase her income as she has her own equipment. She wants to expand her business and buy more raw material to give work to a cousin and to make more money. She wants to help her daughter with the profits so that she can study and not stop in mid- flight and one day become a professional.

loans.use: to buy 30 cones of algave thread, spinning wheel and spools.

loans.name: Nyaituguru A Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of five farmers, called Nyaituguru A. The group is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow, socially and economically, through agriculture.

Daniel, who is raising his hand, has just joined the group. He is very excited, because he believes his life will change for the better. He believes he will learn better farming methods that will result in his getting a bountiful harvest. He is married and has ten children, three of whom go to school.

Until now he has depended on subsistence agriculture, but Daniel believes that this will change when he starts using hybrid seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to obtain a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer. With the use of these farm inputs, Daniel believes he will get enough harvest for food in his household, as well as a surplus to sell. He will use the income to pay school fees, for his three children who go to school.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 52 years old and married with six children.

Anselma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow  to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cream, detergent soap, hair conditioner, etc. to sell.

Anselma has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Anselma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cream, detergent soap, hair conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 15000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Thelma has been raising cattle for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 38 years old and married; she has six children. With three of her children still in school, Cynthia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as noodles, salt, sugar, bread, and canned goods.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell, like noodles, salt, sugar, bread, and canned goods. Cynthia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like noodles, salt, and canned goods

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income by farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials for her welding shop business.

Magnolia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her welding shop business

loans.name: Samin

texts.en: Samin appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients, such as sugar, milk, eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

Melanie has been in this business for three years. Melanie earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as sugar, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi operates a food selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. The previous loan helped her boost her business by buying food stuffs for her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es una joven campesina y luchadora que, a sus 21 años de edad ya es madre de un hijo de 4 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental.  Desde que era pequeña sus padres le enseñaron todo lo relacionado con las tareas del campo y, gracias a ello ha podido trabajar como empleada en diferentes fincas lecheras, encargándose del cuidado y ordeño de las vacas. Hace algún tiempo obtuvo sus primeras vacas productoras de leche y, desde entonces se ha encargado de sacar adelante su negocio de manera independiente, toda la producción es vendida y de esta manera genera los recursos económicos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento del hogar. Actualmente solicita nuestro apoyo, pues con el crédito desea comprar dos vacas productoras de leche que le permitirán aumentar la producción y así hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan con los bajos precios de venta y con los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas que requiere para el cuidado de los animales; sin embargo ella es consciente que para lograr sus objetivos, debe continuar luchando con esmero, disciplina y dedicación, sólo así podrá alcanzar el sueño de ampliar su negocio y adquirir mayor número de cabezas de ganado lechero que le garanticen una estabilidad económica favorable para poder brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y disfrutar mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Laura is a young struggling farmer, 21 years old, and the mother of a 4 year old son. She lives accompanied by her life partner. Ever since she was young her parents have taught her everything related to farm work, and as a result she has been able to work as an employee on various dairy farms.

She is in charge of caring for and milking the cows. Some time ago she obtained her first dairy cows and since then she has been handling the success of her business independently. Everything produced is sold and so this generates the financial resources sufficient to assist her husband with the household expenses.

Currently she is asking for help with financing as she wants to buy two dairy cows which will permit her to increase her production and thus cope with the challenges she faces such as low sale prices and the high cost of agricultural supplies that she needs to care for the animals. However, she is aware that to achieve her goals, she must continue fighting with care, discipline, and dedication. Only then will she be able to achieve the dream of expanding her business and of buying a greater number of dairy cattle that will guarantee a favorable financial stability in order to be able to offer her son a better education and to enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 32-year-old lady.  She is living with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  At the time when she was newly married, their financial condition was very poor because her husband did not have much skill to work on a lathe machine.  He has been learning the techniques to work on a lathe machine from professionals. Now he has come to know how to operate a lathe machine so that he can carry on his newly started business. Due to his lack of experience, the lathe machine has gotten damaged and needs maintenance. 

Therefore, Noor requested a loan for her husband so that he can fulfill the deficiencies of the lathe machine and can buy additional tools, dyes, spare parts, etc. Noor is tension free now because she hopes that her husband will become an expert soon and get a reasonable income as an expert turner.

Noor is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: with the maintenance of a lathe machine and to buy additional spare parts, tools, dyes and a cutter to work on a lathe machine.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se dedica hacer pan como forma de tener ingresos para salir adelante con su familia, la apoya su hijo, ella vive una casa propia con su hijo y su nieto. Por el momento su negocio no representa ningún problema.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar harinas, levadura, royal, azúcar, sal, para surtir el inventario de su negocio y tener la materia prima necesaria para continuar respondiendo  a la demanda de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas y tener una mejor economía.
Su sueño es tener un negocio rentable para cancelar sus deudas y que sea auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Maria makes bread as a way of having income to make progress for her family. Her son helps her. She lives in her own house with her son and her grandson. At this time, she is not having any problems with her business.

She will use the loan to buy flours, yeast, Royal brand baking powder, sugar, and salt to stock the inventory for her business and have the basic ingredients necessary to continue responding to the demand of her customers. She hopes to increase her sales and have a better [household] economy.

Her dream is to have a profitable business to pay her debts and be self-supporting.

loans.use: to buy flours, yeast, Royal brand baking powder, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more goods like noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, vinegar, laundry soap, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Sheila has been in this business for 7 years. Sheila earns more income from buying and selling natural medicine.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods like noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, vinegar, laundry soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco de 43 años de edad, habita junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 5 añitos, en un barrio de la capital, sus deseos y meta es mejorar su humilde vivienda la que actualmente es de láminas de zinc, siendo insegura ya que son laminas viejas y sarrosas, no presta las condiciones de hogar. Es por eso el motivo del crédito que solicita para comprar materiales de construcción y dar inicio a la obra para hacer su casa, la que hará por etapas, siendo esta la primera, ya que su salario como operador de maquina en una zona franca es muy poco, no le permite hacer la inversión de una sola vez, pues tiene que cubrir gastos principales del hogar y la escuela de sus hijos.
texts.en: Francisco, who is 43 years old, lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two children, ages 10 and 5, in a neighborhood of the capital. His wishes and his goal are to improve his humble home, which is now made from sheets of zinc and is insecure, since the sheets are old and deteriorated, and it doesn't provide appropriate conditions for a home. It is for this reason that the motive for the loan that he is applying for is to buy construction materials and begin the project of building his home, which he will do in stages. This will be the first stage, since his salary as a machine operator in a free zone is very little, and it does not allow him to make the investment all at once, since he also has to cover the principal household expenses and school for his children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: cement, sand, blocks, iron, and gravel

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom is 27-years-old.  She is married and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $5 per day.  Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a driver who makes an income of $6 daily. Due to the lack of funds, Sreymom is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her obtain a convenient house for her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients, such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour, and sugar, which will help her invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia works hard to support her family. Denia is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Denia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her business.

Denia has been in this business for three years now.

Denia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.  She still operates her food stall.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, tea leaves, maize flour and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, tea leaves, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Luz Andrea

texts.es: Luz, a sus 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hijo. Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado en el campo de las ventas, inicialmente en un almacén de ropa donde aprendió la actividad, pero con el ánimo de independizarse y generar mejores ingresos decidió montar su propio negocio con la liquidación y algunos ahorros personales; es un almacén donde vende ropa de combate y variedades como juguetes, artículos decorativos para el hogar, accesorios, entre otros. Actualmente solicita nuestro apoyo para comprar surtido de mercancía al por mayor (juguetes, ropa, accesorios, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, beneficiando directamente la entrada de recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. El principal anhelo de Luz es poder tener un local propio que le permita ahorrar dinero y mejorar la rentabilidad para garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita brindar una mejor educación a su hijo para que tenga un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en: Luz, 33, is married and has one child. During her working life, she has been involved in the field of sales, initially in a clothing store where she learned to do this activity. In the spirit of independence and to generate better revenues, she decided to start her own business with her severance pay and her own personal savings. It is a store where she sells army apparel and an assortment of other items such as toys, decorative items for the home, accessories, and more. She currently requested our support to buy an assortment of wholesale merchandise (toys, clothes, accessories, and more) so she can stock enough to meet demand increases during the Christmas season, directly benefiting her earnings to allow her to cover the basic needs of her family. Luz's main desire is to own her own establishment that allows her to save money and improve profitability to ensure financial stability to enable her to provide a better education for her child to have a prosperous and success future.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of wholesale merchandise such as toys, clothing, accessories, and others.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jenny is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenny has been in the pig fattening business for seven years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Frediswenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Frediswenda works hard to support her family.

She has a feed and rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Frediswenda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice to sell. 

Frediswenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice to sell

loans.name: Rasheedah

texts.en:
Rasheedah describes herself as the person who knows how to “get things done.” After being seriously injured in a car accident, she literally had to relearn how to walk before returning to work. Rather than just waiting to get better, she decided to utilize her administrative skills to do freelance administration for small businesses as an independent contractor.

In response to her growing portfolio of clients, Rasheedah recently decided to launch a full-fledged administrative services company.  Aseelah Administrative Services provides a wide range of services including government procurement, bookkeeping, corporate document and certification compliance, industry research and advising on efficiency. Though Rasheedah works with all kinds of companies, she specializes in helping companies fulfill government contracts. Her attention to detail in particular ensures that her clients are operating in complete compliance with government grants at all times. 

Rasheedah is also a graduate of the Accion Academy for Entrepreneurial Success, an 8-week entrepreneurship course that walks students from business plan to launch. Upon successful completion of the course, students receive a business loan of up to $5,000 funded by Kiva. They also receive the education, tools and encouragement needed to turn their business dreams into a reality.

Graduating from the academy was exactly the kind of boost Rasheedah needed to finally launch her business. She will use her $5,000 Kiva loan to purchase a new computer and much needed software for her business. She will also build a new website to help her acquire new clients.

As Rasheedah’s business grows, she is determined to create her own agency and eventually hire employees to offer more services. “I’m hoping to build a solid foundation for my son and niece to have a bright future,” said Rasheedah.

loans.use: to pay for a new website, a computer and software for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice and feed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice and feed to sell. 

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. Teresita earns more income from raising livestock.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and feed to sell

loans.name: Phek

texts.en: Phek is 30 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a sanitation worker for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. Due to a lack of funds, Phek is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her obtain a convenient house for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store from her home and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Dianne

texts.en:
Dianne is 26 years old, has a live-in partner and is the mother of two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dianne has a direct-selling Avon Products business in the Philippines. Dianne has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products to sell, such as lotion, lipstick, perfume, body soap, etc.

Dianne has been in this business for one year. In the future, Dianne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products to sell, such as lotion, lipstick, perfume, body soap, etc.

loans.name: Narcesta

texts.en:
Narcesta is 41-years-old and single.

Narcesta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling business of dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut to sell.

Narcesta has borrowed and paid twenty-one loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling business of dried coconut meat for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Narcesta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Dolores requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Dolores has been in this business for three years now.

Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Pingky

texts.en:
Pingky is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Pingky is 40-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Pingky has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Pingky requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Pingky has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Pingky would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Yuliana Shirley

texts.es:
Yuliana, es una joven emprendedora de 25 años de edad, durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes negocios de ventas de helados y frutas pero, con el ánimo de independizarse y generar mejores ingresos por cuenta propia, tomó la iniciativa de abrir su propia heladería, para lo cual ya posee el local ubicado en frente de una institución educativa, pero requiere nuestro apoyo para comprar los activos fijos (nevera, congelador, sillas y mesas, licuadora, utensilios de cocina, entre otros) y los insumos necesarios (helados, frutas, barquillos, salsas dulces) con lo que podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, aprovechando la experiencia que posee para sacarlo adelante. Actualmente su principal desafío es solventar los altos costos que debe pagar por ubicarse en este sector, pero sabe que con esfuerzo, disciplina y dedicación puede sobrepasar todos los obstáculos. 
Su principal anhelo es poder dar a conocer su negocio y acreditarlo cada vez más para que logre tener permanencia en el tiempo y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Yuliana is an enterprising young woman of 25.  During her working life she has been employed by various businesses selling ice cream and fruit, but with the intention of becoming independent and generating greater income on her own account, she took the initiative of opening her own ice cream store.

For this purpose, she already has a location in front of a school, but needs help to buy the fixed assets (refrigerator, freezer, tables and chairs, blender, kitchen utensils, and other items) and the necessary ingredients (ice cream, fruit, wafers, toppings) that will enable her to launch her business project, taking advantage of the experience she has to make it successful. 

Currently her main challenge is affording the high costs one must pay to locate in this part of the city; but she knows that with effort, discipline and dedication she can overcome all the obstacles. Her principal desire is to see her business become well known, with an increasingly better reputation. This is so that with time, she can become well established and be assured of good financial stability, so that she and her husband can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fixed assets (refrigerator, freezer, tables and chairs, blender, kitchen utensils, other items) and the  necessary ingredients (ice cream, fruit, wafers, toppings).

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María, a sus 34 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos de 11, 3 y 1 años de edad. Hace 5 años comenzó a realizar la actividad de venta de productos por catálogo, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía del hogar; sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector y, ella manifiesta que la principal ventaja es que puede ser productiva sin necesidad de descuidar sus hijos y su hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cosméticos, accesorios, cremas faciales y corporales, entre otros), para aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene, lo que le permitirá mejorar el margen de utilidades por cada venta que realice, además podrá fidelizar más a sus clientes ya que tendrá el producto para entregarlo inmediatamente, ya que eso estimula la decisión de compra. María sólo desea poder continuar con su actividad para garantizar a sus hijos una estabilidad económica que le permita brindarles mejor educación y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 34, is married and is the mother of three children aged 11, 3, and 1 years old. Five years ago, she began her business selling products by catalog in order to generate income to contribute to the household economy. Her main customers are family, friends, and neighbors in the area. She says that the main advantage is that she can be productive without neglecting her children and her home. She is currently seeking the support of this loan to purchase merchandise in bulk such as perfumes, cosmetics, accessories, face and body creams, and more to take advantage of the discounts she gets which will allow her to improve the profit margins for each sales she makes. She will also get to retain more customers because she will be able to deliver their products immediately which encourages their decision to purchase. Maria just wants to continue with her activities to ensure financial stability for her children, allowing her to provide better education and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise including perfumes, cosmetics, accessories, and face and body creams.

loans.name: Kanyonge

texts.en:
Kanyonge is a married woman with nine children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling leso (female wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase 40 pieces of Lesos (women's wraps) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of Lesos (women's wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her area. She has become famous for selling good-quality clothes in her community. 

Currently, Shahnaz has taken her first loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season. She will take into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the winter season to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has five children, four in school and one underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Liliana Esmeralda

texts.es: la clienta de 25 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio y de calidad, ella solicita un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor como:  naranjas, piñas, fresas, guineos, papayas, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Liliana is 25 years old. She lives with her life companion and her daughter in their own home. She sells vegetables and fruit. She has been doing this for a number of years and has gained a lot of experience in which sales can make the most profit. The place where she sells is very good for her business plus it has a lot of foot traffic. She has a lot of clients who prefer her because her product is fresh, of good quality and price. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale like: oranges, pineapple, strawberries, bananas, papaya, etc. She wants to make more money to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale like oranges, pineapple, strawberries, bananas, papaya, etc.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is 41 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 each day. Her children are employed; they earn about $14 daily. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pao is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run her own tailoring shop and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es: Doña maría de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos quienes trabajan  y le ayudan en los gastos de su hogar, desde hace varios años ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por la diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de sus hijos logran salir adelante con los gastos que se les presentan, Doña Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own house with her four children who work and help with household expenses.  For several years she has worked selling clothes traveling to different neighborhoods that are close to her home. With the earnings that she obtains and with the help of her children they achieve coming out ahead of the expenses that come up. Maria is requesting a loan to buy clothes at wholesale to be able to continue with her business and to be able to have a better quality of life together with her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Nilton Eduardo

texts.es: Nilton, tiene 21 años, es soltero, vive en casa familiar con sus abuelos y padres. Trabaja en una tienda de electrodomésticos de su localidad como ejecutivo de ventas. Beneficiario utilizara el crédito para remodelar y comprar muebles y enseres para su dormitorio, con ello mejorara su calidad de vida. Su objetivo a corto plazo es empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional para cumplir en el futuro su gran sueño que es ser un empresario y tener su negocio propio.
texts.en: Nilton is 21 years old. He is single and lives in the family house with his grandparents and parents. He works in a local home appliance store as a sales executive. He will use the loan to remodel and buy furniture  and other items for his bedroom in order to improve his quality of living. His short term objective is to study a professional career to accomplish his big dream which is to be a businessman and own his own business.

loans.use: to buy furniture and goods for the bedroom.

loans.name: Recitita

texts.en:
Recitita is 53 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Recitita works very hard to provide for them.

Recitita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Recitita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, etc. 

Recitita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
SANTOS DE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD,  ESTUDIO HASTA SEPTIMO GRADO, POR MOTIVOS ECONOMICOS. ÉL ESTA CASADO Y SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA A LOS OFICIOS DE LA CASA, SU HIJO DE 13 AÑOS ES EL QUE LE AYUDA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA. 


 TODA SU VIDA SE A DEDICADO A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA, EMPEZO A TRABAJAR CON SU PADRE, PUES ÉL ERA UNO DE LOS MAYORES POR LO TANTO TENIA QUE AYUDARLE A TRABAJAR, PARA GANAR EL SUSTENTO DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ÉL TIENE QUE CAMINAR CERCA DE 2 KILOMETROS PARA LLEGAR HASTA DONDE TIENE SU CULTIVO Y PRACTICAMENTE NO TIENE HORARIO, YA QUE DEPENDE DEL CULTIVO Y SE ACOMPAÑA DE SU HIJO DESPUES QUE SALE DE LA ESCUELA YA QUE LE ESTA ENSEÑANDO COMO TRABAJAR LA TIERRA.

CON EL DINERO DEL PRESTAMO, COMPRARA SEMILLAS, ABONO Y TODOS LOS INSUMOS QUE VA A NECESITAR EN LOS 7,000 METROS CUADRADOS DE MAIZ QUE VA A CULTIVAR. 


LOS SUEÑOS SON TENER UNA CASA EN MEJORES CONDICIONES DE LAS QUE AHORA TIENE, TAMBIEN PODER DARLE TODO A SUS HIJOS, EL ESTUDIO QUE ÉL NO TUVO. CON EL PRESTAMO  SABE QUE ES UN COMPROMISO PERO A LA VEZ TIENE CLARO QUE LE SERVIRA COMO UN IMPULSO PARA TRABAJAR MAS Y EN MEJORES CONDICIONES Y SABE QUE SOLO LO LOGRARA A BASE DE MUCHO ESFUERZO.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old. He went to school through the seventh grade, due to economic reasons. He is married, and his wife takes care of the house. His son who is 13 is the one who helps him work in agriculture.

He has worked in agriculture all his life. He began to work with his father, since he was one of the oldest, and so he had to help him work to earn a living for the whole family. He has to walk about 2 kilometers to arrive at his field. He doesn't have a regular schedule, since it depends on the crop, and his son accompanies him after he leaves school, since he is teaching him how to work the land.

With the money from the loan, he will buy seeds, fertilizer, and all the supplies that he is going to need for the 7000 square meters of corn that he is going to grow.

His dreams are to have a house in better conditions than those he has now, and also to be able to give all his children the education he did not have. With the loan, he knows that it is a commitment, but he also knows well that it will serve as an incentive to work more and in better conditions, and he knows he will only achieve it based on much effort.

loans.use: to buy the seeds, fertilizer, and all the supplies that he is going to need for the 7000 square meters of corn that he is going to grow

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to resell in her buy-and-sell banana business.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. Teresita earns more income from raising livestock.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Nemeh

texts.en:
Nemeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. Nemeh is a 29-year-old married woman from a small village near Gaza city. She lives with her husband and five kids- two sons and three daughters- in a simple house. Nemeh's husband works in the public sector and earns a low income. Nemeh could not complete her studies directly after school, so she registered recently in the university to get a BA degree. She studies Elementary Education. She would like to finish her studies to find a job and help her husband with part of the family's expenses.

Nemeh took a 625 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop to study. By taking this loan, Nemeh will be able to do her homework and write the reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to study

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en: Theavy is 40 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is an excavator driver who earns about $4 daily. Due to a lack of funds, Theavy is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase timber to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix her house

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is 33 years old and married with four children. With four children surrently in school, Carolyn works very hard to provide for them.

Carolyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods, such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

Carolyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc. 

Carolyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods, such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
Necita is 34 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Necita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional seeds for her farm.

Necita has been farming vegetables for two years and earns additional income from providing motorcycle transport and farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds for her farm

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Editha is 38 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Editha has a retailing rice business in the Philippines. Editha requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Editha has been in this business for two years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines.

Edna has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business, such as nail polish, a nail cutter, a nipper, etc.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years now. Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, such as nail polish, a nail cutter, a nipper, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
