Edna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Edna is 44 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Edna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

Edna has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma requested a loan for her husband to buy an ice cream making machine. He wants to start to offer ice cream in the evening to the children of his area. For this purpose, he needs an ice cream making machine, milk, powder, etc., to start this business. In the morning he works at a small job in a firm for a low salary.

Najma is 38 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children, who live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Najma hopes that through this machine her husband will be able to earn additional income. Najma thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: To buy an ice cream making machine to make ice cream to sell in the community.

loans.name: Upendo 2 Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Upendo 2 and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand is John. He is 48 years old, married with five children. John has joined the group for the first time and has had the opportunity to be educated on improved farming methods.

John desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains season.  He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase these farm inputs. He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also be able to sell the surplus and obtain money to invest in a dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

She has operated a business of mat weaving for sale, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a big business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase beads and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beads and sewing materials

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar, 25, is a single woman who lives in the City of Jenin in northern Palestine. To help  two of her family members, Azhar  has decided to take a loan from the Arab Center for Agricultural Development. 

Azhar has suffered from hearing impairments since birth and is unable to engage in the Palestinian labor market. As a result, she has decided to begin her own project, a tailoring project, and to depend on it as a main source of income.

Azhar has begun her project with part of her own money and has borrowed some from ACAD to purchase sewing machines. Her goal is to expand this project, since it provides the only source of livelihood for her and her sister.

Azhar's challenges are hearing disabilities and a lack of people who deal with her, in addition to the difficulty of marketing.

She would like to thank ACAD and Kiva for giving her this chance to share her story.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda como maderas, clavos, calaminas, entre otros, de esta manear podrá mejorar el techo de su vivienda sobre todo ahora que es temporada de lluvias, Edith podrá seguir trabajando en su negocio de venta de comidas con mayor tranquilidad y seguira luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una mejor casa”.
texts.en: Edith is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their great support she will be able to buy construction materials such as wood, nails, and corrugated metal sheets, among other items, to be able to make improvements in her house. Above all, she will be able to improve the roof of her home now that it is the rainy season. Edith will be able to continue working with greater tranquility in her business of selling food, and she will continue to strive to make a reality of her great dream: to have a better house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
El es luis felipe, escogió auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos porque le gusta la parte de la salud para poder servirle a aquellas personas que necesitan de esta atención, ya sea por la parte de los medicamentos o dispositivos médicos, a parte de esto porque la salud es una carrera donde se aprenden muchas cosas interesantes y buenas, las cuales le pueden servir a la comunidad, una de esas podría ser la parte de inyecto logia.
Esta carrera la escogió porque la farmacia tiene muchos temas interesantes y también porque los ingresos económicos  son buenos, el convenio con kiva realmente seria una gran ayuda muy buena porque no cuenta con los ingresos adecuados para pagarse la carrera completa.
Con este logro, como lo es terminar la carrera de auxiliar de farmacia es mas adelante, en un futuro, poder formar su propio establecimiento farmacéutico como lo seria droguería, entre esas y poder contar con unos ingresos buenos y estables para poder ayudar con las labores de su casa, y a si poder adelante y tener su propia casa en un futuro mas adelante.
Al terminar este técnico el podría ayudar a muchas personas con la parte de la salud podrá servirle a la comunidad con algo que se trata todos los días.
texts.en:
This is Luis Felipe. He chose the pharmacy assistant program because he likes this area of health which deals with being able to help people who require such attention, whether it be in regard to medicine or medical devices. Aside from this, he also likes it because many interesting and positive things are learned from this program. These things can be of service for the community, such as the knowledge of administering injections. 

He chose this program because pharmaceutical sciences have many interesting topics and also because the salaries are good. The agreement with Kiva will truly be a very great help because he does not have the adequate income to pay for the entire program. 
 
After completing his pharmacy assistant program in the future, he would like to set up his own pharmaceutical establishment later on, such as a drugstore. Also, he would like to be able to rely on a good, stable income to be able to help with housework, and so be able to get ahead and own his own home later on in the future. 

Upon completing this program, he would be able to help many people in the area of health. He will be able to serve the community with something that he is involved with on a daily basis.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Don José, tiene 62 años de edad, es  casado, tiene dos 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. El tiene su propio negocio de  taller de tapicería en general, repara muebles de sala, asientos de motos, de carros y sillas en general. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 20 años y funciona  en su casa. Lleva tres ciclos de préstamos con el actual, el cual es por 15,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como telas, esponja, pegamento, grapas y otros, para tapizar un lote de sillas que le han pedido sus clientes y así va cumplir con sus compromisos de trabajo. Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder ver a sus hijos graduados.
texts.en: José is 62 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. He has his own upholstery business, repairing living room furniture, car and motorcycle seats and chairs in general. He has had this business for 20 years and works out of his house.This will be his third loan cycle. This loan is for 15,000 HNL and he will invest it buying raw materials like fabric, sponge, glue, staples, etc to upholster a group of chairs for his clients to fulfill his work commitments. His goal is to continue working to see his children graduate.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, sponge, glue, staples, etc to upholster some chairs for his clients.

loans.name: Ma. Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising livestock. Ma. Josefina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers in her fish vending business.

Ma. Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to resell in her general store.

Perla has been in this business for seven years. Perla earns more income from raising livestock.

Perla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to resell in her fish vending business.

Salvacion has been in this business for seven years. Salvacion earns more income from raising livestock.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to resell.

loans.name: Amorlita

texts.en:
Amorlita is 30 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Amorlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Amorlita has been pig fattening for four years, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell in her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Melba has been in this business for five years. Melba earns more income from a general store.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Lorna has been pig fattening for 10 years, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es: Don Anselmo, es un señor dedicado a la actividad comercial de venta de prendas de acero y plata,  negocio que le ha permitido subsistir en la vida, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, don Anselmo es soltero, con este crédito que solicita busca incrementar las ventas y abastecerse de productos para seguir vendiendo, tanto en el mercado como en su casa de habitación, espera con esta inversión mejorar su economía aprovechando esta buena temporada de fin de año.
texts.en: Anselmo sells jewelry made of steel and silver and his business provides him with enough income to get by.  He is single and has a school-age son.  With the loan he is requesting he is seeking to increase his sales and stock up on products so he can keep selling at the market and at his home. He hopes that this loan will allow him to improve his finances by taking advantage of increased sales at the end of the year.

loans.use: to invest in silver and steel.

loans.name: Iván David

texts.es: Iván, con 33 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos e 5 y 7 años y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Desde hace varios años se dedica a trabajar como mecánico automotriz, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que le ha servido para montar su propio taller en el que trabaja con su hermano todos los días de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm, adicionalmente también presta su servicio a domicilio para desvarar algún vehículo; de esa manera genera un ingreso adicional para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar un taladro de prensa y una prensa hidráulica, con lo que podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y prestar un mejor y más ágil servicio a sus clientes; dando como resultado un incremento en la entrada de recursos para su familia. Iván tiene como prioridad, cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio para poder generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y lograr que el establecimiento perdure en el tiempo para dejar un buen legado a sus hijos, que les permita vivir cómodamente y sin ningún tipo de necesidad económica.
texts.en: Iván, who is 33 years old, is the father of two children, ages 5 and 7. He lives in free union with his partner. He has worked for a number of years as an auto mechanic, a trade that he learned empirically and that has allowed him to set up his own shop, where he works with his brother every day from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. In addition, he makes service calls to do temporary repairs; in this way he generates additional income to cover the basic necessities of his family. Now he is applying for the support of a loan in order to buy a drill press and a hydraulic press, with which he will be able to improve working conditions and offer a better and more adept service to his customers, and as a result increasing his family income. Iván has as a priority achieving his dream of expanding his business to be able to generate new employment opportunities and seeing that his establishment endures so that he can leave a good legacy to his children, which will allow them to live comfortably and without any type of economic need.

loans.use: to buy a drill press and a hydraulic press

loans.name: Esperanza Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica vive en al ciudad de Chiclayo, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual pudo iniciar gracias a su esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro; Angélica es madre de 1 hijo, al cual quiere mucho y su motor para salir adelante.

Angelica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar abarrotes para su negocio como arroz al por mayor, azúcar, fideos, entre otros con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y de esta manera poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”poder tener un minimarket”.
texts.en: Angelica lives in the city of Chiclayo. She works in her small business of selling groceries. She was able to start it thanks to her effort and above all, savings. Angelica is the mother of one son who she loves very much and who is her driving force to get ahead. Angelica is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support she will be able to buy groceries for her business such as wholesale rice, sugar and noodles, among other things. With these she will be able to supply her business and in this way make her great dream a reality: "to be able to have a mini-market".

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Junior Alexander

texts.es: Junior, tiene 21 años, vive en casa familiar con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 1 y 2 años. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa agrícola de su localidad como operario de campo. Beneficiario utilizará el crédito para compra de una cuna para el menor de sus hijos y otros enseres domésticos. Su sueño es tener una empresa propia que le permita generar mayores ingresos que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y comprarse su casita.
texts.en: Junior is 21 years old. He live in his family home with his wife and two children, aged 1 and 2.  Right now he is working at an agricultural business in his community as a field worker. He will use the loan to buy a cradle for his youngest child and other household items. His dream is to have his own business that will allow him to generate more income that will enable him to improve his family's quality of life and buy a little house.

loans.use: to buy a cradle and household items for his youngest child.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is 56 years old, and she manages a sari-sari (variety) store business.She has been involved in this kind of business for almost 16 years.

She knows that the more items she stocks in her store, the more the income she will gain. With regards to this matter ,she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000, which will allow her to buy additional grocery items such as shampoo, biscuits, drinks, eggs, soap and candies. She believes that through completeness of the grocery items she offers to her locality, she will be able to give satisfaction to her costumers and at the same time she could earn s higher income.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as shampoo, biscuits, drinks, eggs, soap and candies for her general store

loans.name: Gladis Yolanda

texts.es: Gladys, tiene 46 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 3 años que estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica, vende  granos básicos, azúcar, jabón, papel higiénico, carnes, churros, dulces, pan, manteca, y también ollas de cocina. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 20,000 lempiras, con este préstamo espera surtir de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar, jabón, manteca, carnes, churros y otros abarrotes, con el propósito de obtener mejores utilidades. Tiene como meta, seguir trabajando y obtener mejores ganancias y así poder tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Gladis is 46 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her husband with whom she has two kids. She lives in the city of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. She has always worked in business and three years ago she set up a convenience store where she sells staple goods: basic grains, sugar, soap, toilet paper, meats, donuts, candies, bread, butter, and also cooking pots. The loan that she is requesting is the second cycle and is for 20,000 lempiras. With this loan she hopes to stock food products like basic grains, sugar, soap, butter, meats, donuts, and other groceries with the purpose of gaining better profits. She has as a goal to continue working and obtain better earnings and so to be able to have a better style of life.

loans.use: to stock food products like basic grains, sugar, soap, butter, meats, donuts, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Juanita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 43 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Carmelita has a buy-and-sell school supplies and medicines business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of school supplies and medicines to resell.

Carmelita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of school supplies and medicines to resell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Mona works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell plastic rope (straw) business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising livestock. Mona is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to resell to her customers in her buy-and-sell plastic rope (straw) business.

Mona has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plastic rope (straw) to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and additional ingredients for her business.

Visitacion has been in this business for two years. Visitacion earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 39 years old and is married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years old and married with eight children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Zenaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: José Jesús

texts.es: José es un campesino de 46 años de edad, nacido en el seno de una familia muy humilde que le enseñó desde muy pequeño a realizar todas las tareas del campo para que cuando creciera pudiera conseguir su propio sustento; gracias a ello, hace más de 31 años, se dedica a la agricultura, ya que posee cultivos de maíz, fríjol y curuba; además tiene ganado de levante y es productor lechero, toda la producción que saca de sus diferentes actividades, es vendida para generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia, conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años. Con el ánimo de darle continuidad a sus actividades, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar dos vacas productoras de leche que entrarán a reemplazar a dos animales que están en período de gestación; así podrá mantener su nivel de producción para poder hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan por los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas que requiere y a los bajos precios de venta de sus productos. José dice que su principal meta es lograr ampliar su producción de leche, pues tiene mucho espacio disponible para tener más animales y así poder lograr una estabilidad financiera que le ayude a brindar un mejor futuro y bienestar a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en: José is a farmer of 46. He was born into a very humble family who taught him when he was very young to do all the farm chores so that when he was grown he could earn his own livelihood. Thanks to that, he has worked in agriculture for more than 31 years, and he now has plantings of corn, beans, and passion fruit. In addition, he has breeding cattle and produces milk. All the production that he obtains from his different activities is sold to generate sufficient income to pay the expenses of his family, which consists of his wife and two children, ages 8 and 6. With the intention of continuing his activities, he is applying for the support of the loan to buy two milk cows that will replace two animals that are in a period of gestation. Thus he will be able to maintain his level of production so that he will be able to face the challenges that are presented to him because of the high costs of the agricultural supplies that he needs and the low sales price for his products. José says that his principal goal is to expand his production of milk, since he has a lot of available space to have more animals and thus be able to achieve a financial stability that will help him to offer a better future and well-being to his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows

loans.name: Ruben Antonio,

texts.es: Ruben de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, el se dedica a la elaboración de camarotes, roperos, gabeteros, etc. todo de madera, posee clientela fija ya que vende sus productos en los comercios que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ruben esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: madera, clavos, barniz, pintura, etc. para seguir elaborando dichos muebles y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ruben is 30 years old. He lives in his own home with his life's companion and their two children, aged 10 and 4. He works making bunk beds, wardrobes,  file cabinets, everything out of wood. He has regular customers because he sells his products in stores that are close to his residence. With what he earns from his sales he is able to pay for some household expenses. Ruben is asking for a loan to buy necessary materials such as wood, nails, varnish, paint, etc., to keep making the furniture and earning more profits to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish, paint, etc.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora. María está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito 26-71 y sus deseos son de superación y espera que todo le vaya muy bien y poder estrechar aún más sus lasos de amistad con cada una de sus integrantes. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de paisajes inigualables, su centro histórico conserva su arquitectura al igual que su gente conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora María tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad, todos los solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su ultimo hijo de 11 años está estudiando en el colegio, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña María se dedica a la venta ambulante de granos tiernos, negocio que le ha permitido mejorar la económica de su hogar, sus productos los vende de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de más granos para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is taking out her first loan with her friends and companions from the 26-71 credit group. What she wants is to get ahead and she hopes that it goes very well for her and that she and the other members can become even better friends. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city that has unique scenery. Its historical center conserves its architecture while its people conserve their culture and traditions. 

María is 47 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 5 children. Four of them are already grown. All of them are single and help her financially. Her youngest child is 11 and he is in school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. The house they live in is rented.

María works selling young grains as a street vendor. This business has allowed her to improve the household budget. She sells her products Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule. She is going to invest the money from the loan on buying more grains to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte  del grupo de crédito 26-71, se encuentra en este grupo desde hace 2 años tiempo en el que los créditos le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de paisajes inigualables, su centro histórico conserva su arquitectura al igual que su gente conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora María tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo tiene discapacidad pasa en casa, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad y último hijo en el colegio, la casa en la que vive es arrendada, su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios de forma privada.
Doña María labora a diario en su negocio el cual es la venta de productos toperware y también productos de medicina natural y cosméticos, le va bien en su negocio, este es un negocio que le da la oportunidad de cuidar de su familia y apoyar económicamente en su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compa de productos toperware y productos de medicina natural al igual que su crédito anterior. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a part of the 26-71 credit group. She has been in this group for 2 years. During that time, the loans have helped her grow in her business. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city with unique scenery. Its historical center conserves its architecture and its people conserve their culture and traditions. 

María is 47 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 3 children, aged 20, 18, and 13. Her oldest son is disabled and stays at home. Her second son is in college and her youngest son is in high school. The house she lives in is rented. Her husband is a driver by profession and works privately.  

María works every day in her business selling Tupperware and natural medicine products as well as cosmetics. The business is going well for her. It gives her an opportunity to care for her family and support her family financially. 

She will invest the money from the loan in buying Tupperware and natural medicine products, just like she did with the previous loan. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware and natural medicine products.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 39 and has four school-age children. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she runs a small variety store while her husband manages their small repair shop. She aims to improve her store and increase her product offerings, but her capital is not enough to run a business. 

For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more stock of soft drinks, gasoline, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, and seasonings to sell. 

She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, gasoline, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos, desde hace 10 años se dedica a vender ropa, lo hace de lunes  a sábado, es un oficio que aprendió de su madre.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar vestidos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, y faldas, en variedad de estilos, colores y tallas, lo que le servirá para aumentar el inventario de su negocio en las fiestas navideñas, espera obtener mejores ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Aspira con hacer crecer su negocio y tener una mejor economía.
texts.en:
Gladys, 42, is married.  She lives with her husband and one of her children.  She has sold clothing for 10 years.  She works Monday through Saturday.  She learned the business from her mother.

Gladys will use the loan to buy dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, and skirts in a variety of styles, colors, and sizes.  This will serve to increase her inventory for the Christmas holidays.

Gladys hopes to earn better profits to fulfill her obligations, to make her business grow, and to have better finances.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, and skirts

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a sus hijos. Hace 12 años que decidió por establecer su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como lácteos, harina, manteca, refrescos, condimentos, azúcar, churros etc. Este préstamo que solicita es el quinto ciclo, y es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar más productos como granos básicos, carnes, quesos, refrescos, churros y otros para incrementar las ventas y la clientela. Tiene como meta crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Dina is 46 years old. She is a single mother who lives together with her children in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Twelve years ago she decided to open her own business selling basic grocery items such as dairy products, flour, butter, soft drinks, condiments, sugar, churros, etc.

Dina is in her fifth loan cycle. She is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras in order to buy products such as basic grains, meats, cheeses, soft drinks, churros (fried dough pastries), and other items to increase her sales and client-base. Her goal is to grow as a small business owner.

loans.use: to buy more products such as basic grains, meats, soft drinks, churros (fried dough pastries), and other items to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, cereals, coffee, etc. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elvine

texts.en: Elvine is 22 years old and married to Jeremiah. He is a businessman and she has been in business for six years. Right now her monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings. She will use this loan to purchase a freezer and icebox for making more ice creams for sale. She will use her anticipated profit to expand her business. This is her first loan. Her hopes and dreams are to grow and introduce more business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and icebox for her ice cream business

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es: María, a sus 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo, al cual ha sacado adelante sola, pues nunca contó con el apoyo del padre de su hijo. Hace algunos años, comenzó a trabajar como empleada en un almacén de ropa pero, se le presentó la oportunidad de quedarse con el negocio, ya que el dueño tuvo que viajar inesperadamente y le propuso quedarse con él; así que, con ayuda de su padre logró comprar el negocio y desde entonces lleva 7 años en funcionamiento, trabaja sola todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm y, de esta manera ha logrado generar los recursos necesarios para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y para sacar adelante a su hijo. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, chaquetas, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa con la llegada de la temporada decembrina y además cuando hay cosecha de café, pues hay más afluencia de personas y recolectores por el sector, permitiéndole aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que éstas le generan. María sueña con tener un local propio, en el que pueda ampliar su negocio y generar mayor nivel de ventas y ganancias, para que le permita disfrutar de una estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida al lado de su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old. She is the single mother of one child who she has raised alone, as she never had the support of the father of her child. A few years ago she started to work as an employee in a clothing store. The opportunity came up to buy the business as the owner unexpectedly had to travel and proposed selling it to her. So with the help of her dad she managed to buy the business.

She has now been in business for 7 years. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm. In this way she can generate the revenues needed to pay for the household expenses and get her child ahead.

María is requesting the help of a loan to invest in buying wholesale merchandise (jeans, pants, shirts, T-shirts, jackets, etc.). Then she can stock her business to meet the raising demand that comes with the Holiday season and then the coffee harvest. There are more people and coffee middleman in the area which will allow her to increase her sales and the income that this generates.

María dreams of having her own property where she can expand her business and generate more revenue and profit which would allow her to enjoy an economic stability and a better quality of living alongside her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (jeans, pants, shorts, T-shirts, jackets, etc.).

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda works hard to support her family. Nelda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nelda requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, flour, eggs, spices, etc.

Nelda has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Nelda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, flour, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna, 55, works hard to support her family.

She has been selling various kinds of fruit within her local community; she has been running this business for more than three years. 

To have continuous growth of her fruit vending business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. This loan will be used to buy bananas, apples, grapes, and longgans to sell.

She knows that this loan will enable her to keep her fruit vending business profitable.  In this way, she could save for the future of her six children.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, apples, grapes, and lonngans to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like snack foods, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like snack foods, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ellen is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ellen has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Ellen has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: María Deyanira

texts.es: María, con 56 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos. Actualmente vive con su familia en una finca de su propiedad, donde cultivan diversos productos como guanábana, mandarina, café y otros productos, los cuales son distribuidos al por mayor por su esposo; pero, con el ánimo de complementar los recursos para el hogar, ella tomó la iniciativa de abrir un local para distribuir los productos a las demás personas del pueblo que transitan por el lugar, para ello ya cuentan con el local, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para comprar las estanterías, los muebles y para realizar adecuaciones locativas como pintar las paredes e instalar las vitrinas y estantes, con esto podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, además con el local abierto al público las ventas de los productos se incrementarán y no dependerán solo de las ganancias de su esposo, sino que tendrán otra entrada de dinero para sustentar los gastos de la familia. María sólo desea que su negocio crezca a medida que se da a conocer y que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo; así podrá cumplir el sueño de seguir brindándole educación universitaria a sus hijos para que tengan un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. Actually she lives with her family on a farm that she owns where they different products like  guanábana (soursop), mandarin oranges, coffee, etc. Her husband wholesales them. 

As a complement to the household resources, she has decided to open a shop to distribute them to the others in her community who pass by. She already has the shop but needs the help of a loan to buy shelves and furniture and make improvements to the shop like painting the walls and installing the windows and shelving. Then she can start this project which could improve the life of the family. Also with a shop open they will sell more product and not have to depend wholly on the earnings of her husband. They will have another source of sustenance for the family.

María hopes that the business will grow as people come to know it and that it is profitable and sustainable. Then she can realize her dream of providing university education to her children so they have a prosperous and  successful future.

loans.use: to buy shelving and furniture and to make improvements to the shop such as painting the walls, installing windows and shelves.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. Дочери 12 лет, учится в школе. Назгул имеет высшее образование, она работает преподавателем в местной школе, у нее большой опыт работы с детьми, поэтому все дети села и их родители очень уважают ее как высокопрофессионального преподавателя и просто человека. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Назгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 13 овец. Супруг - фермер, помогает Назгул по хозяйству. Вместе с супругом они дружно заготавливают корм, меняют воду, чистят в хлеву. Назгул успевает преподавать в школе и следить за своим хозяйством. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена купить автомашину.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 41 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising one daughter. Her daughter is 12 years old and is in school. Nazgul has a higher education. She works as a teacher in a local school. She has a lot of experience working with children, therefore all the children in the village and their parents respect her very much as a highly-qualified teacher and simple person.

As a source of additional income for her family, Nazgul is engaged in raising livestock, having started 19 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 6,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Nazgul currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows, two horses, and 13 sheep. Her husband - a farmer - helps Nazgul around the farm. Together they prepare the feed in unison, change the water, and clean the stable. Nazgul manages to teach at the school and to take care of her household. Monthly income consists of 8,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Nazgul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy steers for fattening and subsequent sale at the market at a high price.

Nazgul plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of domestic animals, and also in the future intends to purchase an automobile.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Thoy

texts.en:
Thoy (in the photo) lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She has three sons and one daughter. Two are married, one is a garment worker and another one attends school. Her husband is a construction worker.

Thoy grows some of the jasmine and longan she sells on her own land, and buys more from other growers in her village to resell at market.  

She is asking for a loan to buy longan under contract for resale before harvesting for the future season.

loans.use: To buy longan under contract for resale.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола добрая и отзывчивая женщина из города Кургантюбе. Ей 31 год. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее дочерям по 12 и 7 лет, а сыну 5 лет. Лола последние два года занимается шитьем национальных стеганых ватных одеял - курпа и курпача. Ее услуга всегда востребованная, так как в каждой таджикской семье для дочери, выходящей замуж и для новой невестки шьют курпа и курпача. Поэтому у нее хороший прибыльный бизнес. Муж Лолы работает в России на стройке и ежемесячно высылает жене деньги на семейные расходы. Сейчас Лола хочет помочь зятю - мужу сестры. Ее зять несколько лет занимался услугой по перевозке пассажиров на собственном автомобиле. Недавно у них был капитальный ремонт дома. Сестра и ее муж не рассчитали своих финансовых возможностей и они вынуждены были продать автомобиль, чтобы завершить ремонт. Теперь их семья осталась без источника дохода. Лола видит трудное положение их семьи и хочет помочь им. У нее есть немного сбережения и еще она просит в кредит недостающую сумму. Лола собирается купить новый хороший автомобиль, а ее зять планирует сделать на машине установку газа и продолжить свой малый бизнес. Они действительно нуждаются в этом кредите.
texts.en:
Lola is a kind and responsible woman from the city of Qurgan-Tube.  She is 31 years old, married, and she has three children (two daughters who are 12 and 7 years old, and a son who is 5).  For the past two years, she has been sewing traditional Tajik comforters from quilted cotton called, "kurpa" and "kurpacha".  Her sewing services are always in high demand because in every Tajik family, a young woman receives a "kurpa" and "kurpacha" when she gets married.  For this reason, Lola's business is quite profitable.

Lola's husband works on a construction site in Russia, and sends money home every month so that his wife can take care of the family's expenses.  Lola currently wants to help her brother-in-law (her sister's husband), who, until now, had been providing taxi services, for a few years, using his own car.  However, Lola's sister and and brother-in-law have had to perform major repairs in their house lately.  Having miscalculated their financial capacity, they ended up having to sell the car to complete their home repairs, which left the family without any source of income.  Lola is well aware of her sister's difficult circumstances, and she would like to help her.

Lola already has some savings, but she is also requesting a loan to cover the missing amount.  She plans to buy a good-quality new car for her brother-in-law.   Her brother-in-law plans to convert this car to natural gas, and will use it to resume his activity. Lola and her family really need this loan.

loans.use: to buy a passenger car for her sister's husband, so that he can resume his business.

loans.name: Janybek

texts.ru: Жаныбек 53 года, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 1 дочь. У Жаныбека - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в школе, дочь Жаныбека-Эльнура также пошла по стопам отца и тоже работает в школе -учительницей. Супруга-домохозяйка, помогает Жаныбеку по хозяйству. Жаныбек легко находит общий язык со всеми людьми, простой в общении, старается всегда быть в хорошем впечатлении от жизни, так сказать оптимист по жизни.В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жаныбек занимается животноводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жаныбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 17 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаныбек обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жаныбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Janybek is 53 years old, married, and together with his spouse is raising one daughter. Janybek has a higher education and works as a schoolteacher. Janybek's daughter Elnura also followed in her father's footsteps and works in a school as a teacher. His wife is a homemaker and helps Janybek around the homestead. Janybek easily finds common language with all people, is easy in communications, tries always to be in good spirits on life, that is to say he is an optimist in life.

As an additional source of income for his family, Janybek is engaged in animal husbandry, having started 28 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to his hard work, Janybek currently has on his homestead: six dairy cows and 17 sheep. Monthly income consists of 6,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Janybek turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy sheep to increase the headcount of livestock.

Janybek plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the construction of a new home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилчону 20 лет. Он уроженец района Яван. Одилчон единственный кормилец в семье. С ним живут его мама и 14 летний братишка. Одилчон работает оператором, но зарплата у него маленькая по этой причине он начинает новую деятельность - новый бизнес. Одилчон насчитанный молодой человек и имеет свой бизнес план. Он собирается заняться продажей одежды на рынке. Он будет закупать товар из города Душанбе, и перепродавать на местном рынке. Так как у Одилчона есть другая работа, он будет работать на рынке всего один день, в свой выходной. В другие дни, продажей одежды будет заниматься его младший брат. Одилчон старается, чтоб его семья не в чем не нуждалась. И делает для этого все. Одилчон просить кредит на сумму $3000 с надеждой, что вы ему поможете!
texts.en:
Odiljon is 20 years old. He is a native of the Yavan region. Odiljon is the sole breadwinner for the family. With him lives his mother and 14-year-old little brother. Odiljon works as an operator, but his salary is small and for this reason he is starting a new activity - a new business.

Odiljon is an enterprising young man and has his own business plan. He intends to engage in selling clothes at the market. He will sell goods from Dushanbe, and resell in the local market. Since Odiljon has other work, he will work in the market just one day, on his free day. On other days, his younger brother will sell clothing. Odiljon tries so that his family will want for nothing. And he does everything for this end. Odiljon is requesting a loan of $3,000.

loans.use: to start a new business selling clothing.

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru: Мирзо жизнерадостный человек, трудолюбивый работник, заботливый отец и любимый муж. Он родился в 1966 года. Он более 2 лет работает в частной организации водителем. Мирзо имеет 1 ребенка, которому 17 лет. Мирзо каждый месяц получает зарплату и использует для обеспечения своей семьи. Мирзо уже несколько лет собирал денег для ремонта дома. Он начал ремонт дома, но у него недостаточно денег для завершения ремонта. Мирзо запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, песок и т.п. для штукатурки стен, укладка забор. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mirzo is a cheerful person, hardworking employee, loving father and cherished husband. He was born in 1966. For more than two years, he has worked in a private organization as a driver. Mirzo has one child, who is 17 years old. Every month, Mirzo receives a salary and uses it to support his family. For several years already, Mirzo has collected money for home repairs. He started repairing his home, but he has insufficient funds for completing the repairs.

Mirzo is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, etc. for plastering walls and laying a fence.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and soil for repairing his house

loans.name: Daryo

texts.en: Daryo is a hardworking and ambitions woman. She is 20 years old. Daryo is married and has a child. She lives with her child and husband in the capital of Tajikistan. Her husband is a taxi driver. His income is not enough to provide the family with all their necessities. She is going to organize a new business to get a good income. Daryo wants to open a mini-café where she is going to make and sell hamburgers and Turkey Shaurma (spit-roated meat served in a sandwich or a wrap). She is going to hire a worker to help her to make hamburgers and Turkey Shaurma. She studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and was very glad for the course. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy food products and to buy equipment for making Turkey Shaurma. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making Turkey Shaurma and food products for her new mini cafe

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситора молодая мама. Она разведена. Не смотря на то, что имеет  маленького ребенка, она работает и зарабатывает себе на жизнь. Ситора живет в доме у родителей, с мамой, сестрой и сыном. Её отца убили  во время гражданкой войны. Два  брата клиентки находиться за пределами республики на заработках в Российской Федерации. Её сестренка занимается  перепродажей парфюмерии, покупает у оптовиков  товар и распределяет их по своим клиентам, которые имеют свои точки на рынках и в торговых центрах.Ситора работает в сферы коммунального хозяйства, в должности бухгалтера. Кроме того она учится заочно в университете. Она  хочет использовать займ, чтобы отремонтировать кухню, ванную комнату,  а так же поменять межкомнатные двери. Ситора запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов и дверей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sitora is a young divorced mother.  In spite of the fact that she has a young child, she is working to support herself.   She lives at home with her family, which includes her mother, sister and nephew.  Sistora's father was killed during the civil war.  Sitora also has two brothers who are currently working in Russia.  

Sitora's sister is a reseller: she buys perfumes from wholesalers and distributes them to various clients who own retail outlets at markets and shopping centers.

Sitora herself works as an accountant in the public sector and is also studying part-time at the university.  She wants to receive a loan to repair the kitchen, bathroom, and change the doors inside the family's house. She is taking a loan of 3,000 USD to buy some building materials and doors.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials and doors to repair her house.

loans.name: José Marcos

texts.es:
Don José de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, no pudo seguir estudiando debido a los escasos recurso de su familia y llevar ingresos a su casa. Esta casado, su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda a la siembra de maíz; ademas  es pastor de la iglesia de su cantón, con ellos viven 3 nietos de la hija que esta en Estados Unidos. 

Don José es una persona humilde dedicado a su familia y  a su iglesia, responsable que se dedica al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, se ha dedicado toda su vida a lo mismo, lo aprendió de sus padres y no habiendo mas oportunidades de trabajo pues decidió dedicarse siempre al cultivo. No se dedica a nada mas y solamente le ayuda una hija que esta en estados Unidos. Viaja como 15 kilómetros hasta donde cultiva solo le ayuda su nietos y su esposa trabaja durante toda la mañana de 5 a 12 del medio día.   

El préstamo sera invertido, para comprar mas insumos para la cosechas de riego. Así se le estará dando la oportunidad a Don José, de sembrar en esta temporada para llevar  ingresos para su familia,  a la vez, que ahorre para  los estudios del próximo año de sus tres nietos hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is 65 years old and has a third grade education.  He was not able to continue due to his family’s lack of resources.  He is married, his wife is a housewife and she helps him with the corn planting.  He is also a pastor in a church and three grandchildren, from their daughter who is in the United States, live with them.

Jose is a humble person, dedicated to his family and to his church.  He is a responsible man who raises corn and vegetables and has done this all his life.  He learned this from his parents and he has not had any other work opportunities.  He doesn’t work at anything else, but he helps his daughter who is in the United States.  He travels about five km to his crops.  His wife and grandchildren help him from 5:00 am to noon every morning.

He will use the money from this loan to buy more harvesting supplies.  In this way Jose can have the opportunity to plant this season and take an income home to his family, while he also saves up for his grandchildren’s next school year.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргизе  37 лет  она родилась и выросла   в  семье дехканина. С детства помогала родителям выращивать скот  и обрабатывать землю.  Но у нее были еще и способности к шитью. Со временем мечта стать швеей превратилась в реальность. Повзрослев Наргиз начала шить сначала себе родным. Понемногу это занятие ей начало приносить доход.  Сейчас Наргиз  мать двоих  детей , ее муж  уехал на заработки.   Как и во всех сельских семьях в ее семье выращивание скота является дополнительным источником дохода.   Дети Наргиз растут и с возрастом детей требуется больше средств на  проживание , обучение детей , содержание семьи.  У  нее небольшая домашняя мастерская и Наргиз хотела бы расширить  свое дело и купить дополнительно  швейное оборудование. Услышав от знакомых про  МДО «Арванд» она решила обратиться к нам для того чтобы взять кредит. Она благодарна что есть такие организации где  взяв  необходимую сумму  можно усовершенствовать свое дело.
texts.en:
Nargiza is 37 years old. She was born and grew up into a family of farmers. From childhood, she helped her parents to tend the livestock and to work the land. But she also had another ability with sewing. Over time, the dream of becoming a seamstress turned into a reality. Growing up, Nargiza started to sew at the beginning for her own relatives. Gradually this activity started to bring her an income.

Now, Nargiza is the mother of two children, and her husband left for work abroad. Like all rural families, her family pursues raising livestock as an additional source of income. Nargiza's children are growing and with age the children need more resources for living, education, and supporting the family. She has a small home workshop and Nargiza would like to expand her work and to buy an additional sewing machine.

She heard from her friends about MDO Arvand and she decided to turn to them in order to get a loan. She is grateful to have this kind of organization where taking a needed sum can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre muy trabajador, cada día trabaja muy duro en su negocio de venta de comida, principalmente los platillos como son el riquísimo caldo de gallina.

Vicente está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar una remodelación al pequeño local donde atiende su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecer una mejor calidad d e atención a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Vicente is a very hard-working man. Each day he works very hard at his business selling food, primarily dishes like delicious chicken soup.

Vicente is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided him, he will be able to remodel the small space where he tends to his business and thus offer a better quality of service to his customers and improve his earnings. In this manner he will be able to keep striving to make his great dream a reality: ”To have a great restaurant.”

loans.use: to remodel his food stall

loans.name: Oneyda Marina

texts.es: Oneyda, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo, vive en el municipio de Puerto, Cortes. Ella obtiene sus propios ingresos vendiendo pupusas (tortilla de maíz rellena con chicharrón y quesillo) y pastelitos rellenos de carne, arroz y papas.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 2 años y 6 meses y lo tiene en un puesto frente  a una estación  de buses. Este préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de una estufa para aumentar la producción y brindar mejor servicio. Su meta es crecer con el negocio y poner otro en un lugar fijo.
texts.en:
Oneyda is 35 years old, is a single mother, has one son and lives in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. She earns an income by selling pupusas (corn tortillas filled with pork and cheese) and savory pastries filled with beef, rice and potatoes. She has had this business for two and a half years and she has her business in a stall in front of a bus station. 

This loan she is asking for is for 10,000 Honduran lempiras, and she will invest it in buying a stove to increase production and provide better service. Her goal is to grow with the business and to open another in a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy a stove to increase production and provide better customer service

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Doña María Eugenia, tiene la edad de 55 años, es habitante de un humilde barrio de Managua, es una señora muy activa, ella comercializa ropa y también hace atoles y helados, los cuales vende en su casa de habitación, siendo soltera sin nadie quien le  brinde apoyo económico, realiza estas diferentes actividades para cumplir con los gastos del hogar y personales, el crédito lo solicita para comprar frutas, azúcar y leche, para hacer mas atoles y vender, con esta inversión desea incrementar las ventas, es por eso que acude a solicitar este apoyo de crédito.
texts.en: María Eugeniais 55 years old and lives in a poor neighborhood of Managua. She’s a busy woman. She sells clothes as well as atoles (sweet corn drinks) and ice cream from her home. Being alone and without anyone to help her financially, she works these jobs to meet her personal and household expenses. The loan she’s asking for is to buy fruit, sugar, and milk to make and sell atoles. She would like to increase her sales with this investment, and this is why she’s asked for a loan from the credit agency.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Massiel Veronica

texts.es: Massiel es una joven de 26 años de edad que habita en casa de su madre ubicada en una comarca cercana a la capital de Managua, su actividad comercial es la venta de productos de cosméticos por catalogo de casa en casa y por encargo, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su pareja con quien ha procreado una  niña que tiene un año de edad. Massiel solicita este crédito con el que desea ponerle techo a su vivienda, la que ha venido construyendo por etapas, siendo esta la segunda, con este financiamiento comprara las láminas de zinc para continuar la obra, ya que con esta inversión podrá ser habitable la vivienda.
texts.en:
Massiel, 26, lives in her mother's house in a region near the capital, Managua.  Her commercial activity is selling cosmetics via catalogue door-to-door and on order.  She has the financial support of her husband, with whom she has a daughter, age 1.

Massiel's requesting this loan to put a roof on her house.  She has been building it in stages, and this is the second stage.  With this loan she'll buy the metal sheets to continue with the work, and the house will be habitable with this investment.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Angela habita en zona insegura por la presencia de delincuentes, ya que es un barrio marginal de la capital y sus pobladores son de escasos recursos económicos, la labor de Angela es el de conserje en una empresa privada, busca la manera de salir adelante en la vida junto a su esposo quien es guarda de seguridad, ambos devengando un salario muy bajo, tiene una hija bajo su cargo a quien apoya para su educación. Doña Angela requiere de este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar la construcción del muro perimetral de su vivienda, esta obra es muy importante para su familia, porque le brindara seguridad y bienestar.
texts.en:
Angela lives in an area that's unsafe because of the presence of criminals.  It's a neighborhood on the edge of the capital and the residents are low income.

Angela works as a caretaker in a private business.  She's looking for ways to get ahead in life with her husband, who's a security guard.  Both of them earn a very low salary.  She has a daughter in her care whose studies she supports.

Angela needs this loan to buy construction materials to start building a wall around her house.  This job is very important for her family because it offers security and well-being.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, and cinder blocks

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda was born in 1967. She has been busy with her own business for more than 10 years. She began her business 10 years ago selling children's clothes. Then she changed her business. Now she sells women's national atlas (ikat weave) fabrics and national marriage dresses for women. She has a good reputation among other businessmen. She is a married parent of two children. Mavluda always tries to improve her living conditions. Mavluda is the main food provider for her children. Her husband makes a little income from his taxi service. She wants to develop her business and maximize the profit. From the profit, she is going to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 9,000 Somoni to buy fabrics and women's dresses to sell. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and women's dresses to sell

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ceferina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales.  Ceferina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ceferina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon (in the photo) lives in a village about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widowed mother with two sons and five daughters. Two of her children are married, one is a chef, two are garment workers, and other two are cobblers in a shoe factory. 

Nuon is a rice farmer. Despite being a widow, she still tries to work. She requests a loan to buy a motorcycle for family use and to buy fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for family use and to buy fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina (in the photo), age 29, is a silk weaver. She lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2010 and has two daughters. One attends school and the other one is still young. Her husband works for a company that produces wine.

Dina built a proper house to live in but she has not paid money for the building fees yet. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to pay fees for her housebuilding. She will also use part of the loan to buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: to pay fees for her housebuilding and buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Rosalia Isabel

texts.es:
Rosalia vive en la ciudad de Camaná, con mucho esfuerzo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien porque es amable con sus clientes.

Rosalia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Rosalia lives in the city of Camaná. With a lot of effort, she works in her small business selling candy. She works about nine hours a day and thinks that her business is going well because she is friendly with her customers.

Rosalia is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business and increase her earnings. In this way she will keep striving to make her great dream a reality: ”To finish constructing her home from stone and wood.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (candy)

loans.name: Chhunla

texts.en:
Chhunla is 21 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River. She has been married since 2011 and has one young daughter. She stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband who is a wooden house constructor.

Chhunla is in the process of building a new house and she lacks some money to finish. That’s why she decided request a loan in order finish it. 

Photo:  Chhunla is standing in her house.

loans.use: to finish building her house

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Phin (in the photo), age 27, lives in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2006 and has two sons: one attends school and the other one is still young. Phin and her husband are farmers. She is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and pay for plowing fees.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and manages a small variety store within the local community. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to support the education of her two children.

Now, she plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has limited capital. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of snack foods, assorted candies, noodles, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that someday, she will make more improvements to the business through continuous access to financial services from lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, assorted candies, noodles, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hard-working mother and supportive wife to her husband in managing their corn farming business.The couple aims to obtain better yields throughout the harvest season.

Marissa is 28 years old and has two children. Being a responsible parent, she aims to educate her children and give them a better life. Marissa plans to improve her corn farming business through a complete application of farm inputs, but she had insufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for labor costs in planting her corn farm land. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs for planting her corn

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a poor but hard-working woman, aged 45, who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. The living standard of her house is not good; she wants to change the living standard of her family. She always keeps in her thoughts how to grow her income and what would be the reasonable source for getting more income, but due to lack of capital she is unable to come true to her plans. 

Her husband has only a single source of income which is sheltering services, and she wants to invest her all savings for the establishment of business. Her husband wants to buy wooden planks and pillars for providing services of sheltering.  

Therefore, she requested a loan for investing more money in her current business.  She hopes that through the loan amount, her husband would be able to buy planks, bamboo, etc. Sughran praises to the Kiva lenders and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material for services.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, es un señor que vive solo ya que su esposa decidió separarse, se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de cerdos y sabe un  poco de albañilería, el distribuye su tiempo para dedicarse a sus actividades, por lo que no cele dificulta realizarlas.
Invertirá en la comprara dos cerdos e insumos agrícolas, para fortalecer su negocio, tener un mejor cosecha de maíz y frijol, aumentar sus ingresos y cancelara las deudas.
Anhela tener los ingresos necesarios para reparar su casa.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives alone because his wife decided to separate from him.  He makes a living in agriculture and raising pigs, and he knows a little about construction work.  He organizes his time to work on his activities, so it's not difficult for him to do them.

Rigoberto will buy two pigs and agricultural inputs to strengthen his business, have a better corn and bean harvest, increase his income, and pay back his debts.

He wants to have the income he needs to fix his house.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Mauricio Andrés

texts.es: Mauricio es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad, luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, se dedicó a buscar empleo para generar ingresos, comenzó a trabajar en un negocio de venta de pan de quesos, donde aprendió la fórmula y el manejo de este tipo de negocios, ya que laboró por 6 meses, pero, con el ánimo de independizarse y generar ingreso por cuenta propia decidió montar su propio negocio de producción de pan de quesos, ubicado en una calle muy transitada del centro de la ciudad donde reside, cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado directo y trabaja de todos los días de 7:00 am a 8:30 pm. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea realizar adecuaciones locativas (arreglar la cocina), para así poder optimizar el espacio y poder cumplir con todas las normas de salubridad que exige la ley, generando más confianza en el cliente sobre el producto que consume lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas. Su principal anhelo es poder hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro montar una empresa de producción de este alimento, para distribuir a otras ciudades y garantizar una rentabilidad que le permita tener mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 21, is an enterprising young man.  After finishing his secondary studies he looked for work to earn an income.  He began working in a business selling cheese bread, where he worked for six months and learned the recipe and the management of this type of business.

He wanted to work on his own and generate his own income so he decided to set up his own business making cheese bread.  It's located on a very busy street in the downtown of the city where he lives.  He has the help of one employee and he works every day from 7 a.m. until 8:30 p.m.

Currently Mauricio's requesting the support of a loan to make modifications to his place (to fix the kitchen) to optimize the space and be able to comply with all the health rules the law obliges.  This will generate more trust in the customers about the product they're consuming, consequently allowing him to increase his sales.

His main wish is to be able to make his business grow and, in the future, start a company to produce this food to distribute in other cities.  This would guarantee him a profitability that would allow him to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to make modifications to his kitchen

loans.name: Santos Daniel

texts.es: santos de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado de doble propósito desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Santos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra  de un ganando de repasto para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 33-year-old Santos lives in his own house with his family. He has made a living by raising dual-purpose cattle for several years. He sells his products in the different markets close to his house. He manages to settle some of his household expenses with what he obtains from his sales.
